column2: Skill required:  Project Management - Program Project Management Designation:  Program and Project Management Specialist Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 7 to 11 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Mobilization vertical and help us contribute for large, complex programs across multiple work streams, which may include transition of work to other geographies, and be accountable for the success, effectiveness, on-time delivery, and business outcomes of the programme You will define and implement processes, organization and operating infrastructures required to set up and begin operations of a new outsourcing engagement or assist in the transition of services from one operating entity to another. You will be working as a part of the team which is responsible for Program and Project Management. This team is highly focused on delivering successful projects to clients on time while ensuring that they are well within the scope and the budget. The team is responsible for initiating, planning and executing projects while also tracking, managing dependencies, predicting and mitigating risks. This team is also responsible for establishing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders and third party vendors. The Credit Management&Assessment team is focused on assessing new customer credit risk, extend customer credit, monitor existing customer, and portfolio credit risk. The team ensures that credit-related activities are carried out as per the agreed timelines with utmost accuracy, ensuring that all possible efforts are made towards achieving cash targets and aging targets. The team works towards ensuring timely completion of cash allocations with minimum posting to unallocated cash, with utmost accuracy while coordinating with credit controllers, aiming at customer delight. They also work towards ensuring periodic action items including the processing of refunds as part of credit balance activities, intercompany refunds. What are we looking for? Ability to perform under pressure  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Ability to handle disputes  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders  Ability to meet deadlines  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  Typically creates new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person requires understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor or team leads  Generally interacts with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  The person should require minimal guidance when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions often impact the team in which they reside and occasionally impact other teams  Individual would manage medium-small sized teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: PROGRAM   MANAGER Organization   Description TNS India Foundation (TNSIF) is a non-profit development organization with over 10 years of experience in implementing robust, effective and demand-driven programs working towards national economic reconstruction, with a special focus on women. By connecting capable individuals to transformative opportunities, we have been able to create an enduring impact for them, their families and communities.  More information can be found at  www.tnsindiafoundation.org TNS India Foundation has been implementing the youth employability program since 2015, and has provided soft skill training to over 24000 youth thereby improving their job readiness and placing them in jobs. Through the program the students are provided training, career guidance, counsellingand formal job opportunities. Inspired with an ambition to place 100,000 disadvantaged youths in jobs by 2027, the program plans to scale-up its geographical presence and scope of interventions significantly. The program aspires to build a scalable platform of blended learning which can transform disadvantaged youth - bringing their households out of the poverty trap. Position   Description: ??Overall project management and operations by ensuring target completion for the donor ??Setting up systems and processes for the team ??Supervising a team of about 10 including trainers, placement support and data support staff ??Overseeing curriculum design and development for imparting industrial skills and green skills ??Overseeing maintenance of online learning platform with content ??Donor reporting and relationship management with senior stakeholders ??Overseeing training and placement team to ensure target completion ??Ensuring and overseeing quality assurance ??Overseeing MIS and data collections ??Supporting business development for the program Preferred   Experience: ??Masters Degree in Business or Development studies ??Overall 10+ years of relevant experience at non profits or corporate organizations and/or    in development sector organizations; ??Clear evidence of responsibility in supporting project implementation and leading a team ??Experience in, or orientation for, working with multiple senior stakeholders ??Exposure to skill development and youth employability projects required ??Exposure to green skills and jobs desirable Skills   Required: ??Entrepreneurial orientation and growth mindset  thrives on problem solving, and able to    get hands-on at times to show the way ??Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to analyze data and write reports and    make presentations to leadership ??Excellent written and oral communication skills ??Understanding of training design, delivery for young adults, and awareness of the Education    + Technology sectors preferred ??People Management Skills and ability to work in and manage a team of 10+ members, ??Willingness to learn all aspects of the role in terms of setting up processes and tools    as applicable ??Willingness to travel within assigned city and nearby regions for partnerships as per project need ??Existing connects with large corporates will be an added advantage ??Desirable qualities for success include but not limited to: integrity, innovation, attention   to detail, goal orientation, ownership and adaptability Interested candidates please share CVs on skandalgaonkar@tnsif.org

column1: Program & Project Mgmt Associate Manager-Marketing Operations
column2: Skill required:Digital Marketing - Program Project Management  Designation:Management Level - Associate Manager  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:10 to 14 years  What would you do? Be a part of the Marketing Operations team that is leading the managed services arm of Accenture. We power our client's business through the integration of insights, data, and technology. We are focused on activating and scaling the best brand experiences, to deliver breakthrough marketing-led growth, cost-effectively, across all digital consumer touchpoints and channels. The value we bring to clients boosts their marketing efficiency and effectiveness that powers their growth. We're looking to hire passionate and innovative leaders in Marketing Operations with deep domain expertise in digital marketing and delivering cutting edge marketing services across a range of clients and industries, bringing with them strong operations acumen and transformative leadership. You will be working as a part of the Digital Marketing team to understand and help clients market their products or services using digital technologies, mainly on the internet, but also including mobile phone apps, display advertising, e-commerce/online shopping website, and any other digital medium. The team also leverages popular tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Workfront Work Management Software, HTML, Javascript, Atlassian Jira, etc. The Program and Project Management team is highly focused on delivering successful projects to clients on time while ensuring that they are well within the scope and the budget. The team is responsible for initiating, planning, and executing projects while also tracking, managing dependencies, predicting, and mitigating risks. This team is also responsible for establishing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders and third-party vendors.  What are we looking for? Product Management  Program Project Management  Project Management  Adaptable and flexible  Agility for quick learning Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  Typically creates new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person requires understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor or team leads  Generally interacts with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  The person should require minimal guidance when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions often impact the team in which they reside and occasionally impact other teams  Individual would manage medium-small sized teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions we re a market leader and growing every day       You can be proud to be a part of technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation     You will be empowered to shape your own career     We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success     Together, we can transform healthcare       The IT Project Manager for Infrastructure and Cybersecurity oversees the planning, execution, and completion of projects related to cybersecurity and IT infrastructure     Responsibilities include coordinating with cross-functional teams, ensuring adherence to security protocols, managing project timelines, assessing, and mitigating risks, and collaborating with stakeholders to achieve project goals     Additionally, this role involves staying updated on cybersecurity trends, implementing industry best practices, and optimizing IT infrastructure to enhance overall security measures     Strong communication and leadership skills are essential for effective project management in this dynamic and critical domain       The role is accountable for development and delivery of comprehensive project plans, program deliverables, including weekly / monthly program updates, KDDs, budget review readiness and management of RAID Logs for cybersecurity and infrastructure initiatives             A Day in the Life           The job responsibilities for an IT Project Manager in Cybersecurity and Infrastructure typically include:                                        Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project plans outlining tasks, timelines, and resource requirements for cybersecurity and infrastructure initiatives. Define the project scope, goals, and objectives, ensuring alignment with organizational strategy. Ensure gate review readiness and facilitate reviews.                                 Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with various stakeholders, including leadership, IT teams, security experts, and business units, external vendors, to define project requirements and expectations.                                 Risk Management: Identify potential risks and issues in cybersecurity and infrastructure projects and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful project execution.                                 Team Coordination: Lead cross-functional teams, ensuring effective communication and collaboration among team members working on different aspects of cybersecurity and infrastructure projects.                                 Budget Oversight: Manage project budgets, monitor expenditures, and ensure cost-effectiveness in implementing cybersecurity measures and infrastructure enhancements.                                 Timeline Management: Monitor project timelines, identify potential delays, and implement strategies to keep projects on schedule.                                 Implementation Oversight: Supervise the implementation of cybersecurity solutions and infrastructure upgrades, ensuring they meet security requirements and organizational objectives.                                 Documentation: Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, progress reports, and post-implementation reviews.                                 Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in cybersecurity and infrastructure management.                                 Communication: Provide regular updates to leadership and stakeholders on project progress, challenges, and outcomes.                                 Customer Satisfaction: Continuously improves stakeholder satisfaction for the Strategic PMO services.             Work closely with all stakeholders to understand the business point-of-view, identify existing processes, customers, and other relevant stakeholders to negotiate and gain cooperation on divergent objectives.                             Processes Standards: Contributes to and cultivates a quality culture which promotes delivery excellence, development of templates tools, process excellence, regulatory compliance, and optimized execution.               Must Have: Minimum Requirements                         15+ years of experience with a bachelor s degree or 7+ years of experience with an advanced degree in program/project management, with a focus on software development and deployment.                          8+ years of leadership experience, including strategic thinking, decision-making, and the ability to inspire and motivate teams.                          Working and practical knowledge of Project and Portfolio Management (PPM) methodologies, tools (Planview).          Technical Skills Desired:                              Ideally PMP Certified                          Knowledge/Experience in leading projects in validated environments                          Experienced in leading multi-function cross-team collaboration between IT and Business                          Experience in managing program timelines, risks, status, escalations in timely manner                          Understand and work within Medtronic processes and tools                          Experience with Project management tools like Planview, Azure DevOps                          Strong knowledge of MS Projects, MS Powerpoint, MS Excel, MS Office Suite of tools                          Experience managing Project Costing, Budget Forecasting, Resource Management           Nice to Have                         Medtronic IT experience                             IT experience within Global Operations Supply Chain, Infrastructure, Cybersecurity                             Understanding of threat landscape, accelerate threat detection, quantify risks, and improve cyber resilience.                                 Establishing a standard framework for Disaster Recovery / Business Continuity Planning.                                  Experience in change management, as it relates to a culture and mindset of a complex organization including capabilities building, process design, ownership, and implementation.                          Ability to work with a highly matrixed organization                          Exceptional influencing skills

column2: Develops, defines, and executes plans of record, including: schedules, budgets, resources, deliverables, and risks. Monitors and drives the program from initiation through delivery, interfacing with internal and external stakeholders across functions on technical matters, as needed. Monitors budget/spending, on-time delivery, and achievement of program milestones. Represents the program and drives alignment across stakeholders.              Responsibilities:             The successful candidate will be responsible for providing program management support to our CPU Engineering team including the following responsibilities:         Plan, drive and deliver CPU development and integration into silicon products.     Lead the creation and maintenance of credible and data-driven schedules and project milestones.     Organize and lead interdepartmental meetings to set project milestones/schedules, plans of records, define project tasks, establish program policies and processes.     Responsible for IP-SoC relationship & partnership program management.     Troubleshoot program issues and help to develop alternative program tasks, schedules, milestones, resource plans, processes etc. to resolve program issues and conflicts.     Determine risks, develop mitigation strategies and communicate information to internal and external key stakeholders. Must be able to proactively drive and solve problems to solutions.     Roll-up and report regularly to senior management-executives on key development milestones, budget, metrics, risks and mitigation plans.     Develop processes to increase the productivity and efficiency of the team.     Manage teams through design, development, test, manufacturing, deployment and sustaining activities for hardware products.     Be an advocate for the program in cross-functional and stakeholder meetings.             Minimum Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.   2+ years of Program Management or related work experience.   1+ year of working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials.             Minimum qualifications:           Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.     6+ years of experience with silicon development.     3+ years Program Management experience or related work experience.     Requires a mix of strong people, technical and analytical skills, superb written and oral communication skills, and the ability to operate in team environments.           Preferred qualifications:           MS or PhD degree in Engineering     Experience as an engineer in chip development and integration into hardware or software systems. Experience with silicon development methodologies, leading tapeouts and silicon validation.     A successful candidate requires a strong IP core (preferably CPU) design & debug background including Project Management of IP team working on multiple programs.     Technical domain expertise in all aspects of VLSI development cycle and IP delivery process.     You will help coordinate and support their methodology deployment and play a key role in planning future IP development initiatives.     Ability to drive teams towards longterm challenging goals and intermediate milestones.     Track record of successful planning and execution within resource and schedule constraints.     Knowledgeable on program management tools and processes to increase productivity across engineering teams.     Proven skills: communication, negotiation, motivation, dealing and resolving difficult and complex situations

column1: Program Manager - AI SW Program Management
column2: Want to join the company that is at forefront of on-device AI device deployment      Are you looking to help manage large scale projects that will bring AI to the mass market      Are you an experienced technical program manager with embedded SW, systems, AI experience, looking to join a rapidly expanding teamIf yes, we have opportunity for you      AISW PMO team at Qualcomm is looking to hire Program Manager with large breadth of technical experience and leadership skills who enjoys being a part of a rapidly growing area with applications in Mobile, Automotive, Internet of Things, Wearables, Computing and XR/AR to name just a few      The successful candidate will work in partnership with engineering and product leadership to manage large scale commercial projects in our Artificial Intelligence space      The ideal candidate would be able to leverage their engineering background to proactively lead the planning and execution of cutting-edge software stack from conception to mass commercialization      If you are someone with AI/NN experience in a technical track looking to expand your scope and breadth of responsibility, this job is for you      We need a highly motivated self-starter that enjoys working in a high energy environment, with the smartest people in the industry.      If you enjoy seeing the results of your strong communication and organizational skills leading to market leadership, this job is for you.                Key Responsibilities:              Drive and deliver overall program alignment and execution across multiple technologies.          Understand requirements priority and drive scoping and planning including interdependencies, staffing constraints and schedule optimization across multiple tech teams.          Partner with Product Management and Engineering, establish clear Plan of Record commitment and enable prioritization.          Establish rigorous execution discipline communications process: risk management, mitigation, tracking, schedule trends vs baseline, recovery actions, executive reporting.          Develop program indicators to manage program health including quality and timelines.          Develop and establish strong processes that streamline the development cycle and integrate multiple plans, dependencies, and deliverables effectively.          Must have strong technical understanding of the program, be articulate, effectively multi-task, stay on top of all aspects of program.          Manage customer and stakeholder expectations, effectively channel customer requirement to internal development teams and drive consensus on development schedule, plan, and processes.          Plan, manage and control the Plan of Record (POR) for technology deliverables for AI-based products by ensuring project plans are implemented on schedule, within scope, and budget.          Translate the organizational strategy and evolving product roadmaps into successful programs, and drive decisions necessary for program delivery by partnering with program sponsors and organizational leadership. Manage priorities based on organization strategy.          Works closely with product management, technology core teams, systems, software, and other leads and program managers to ensure successful and timely delivery of a quality product.          Roll-up and reporting regularly to senior management on key product development milestones, metrics, risks, risk mitigation plans, and staffing status.          Risk management and disciplined management of information to internal and external key stakeholders.          Organize and lead interdepartmental meetings, to set project milestones, define project tasks, establish program policies and processes, and allocate resources.          Ensures change control, priority changes, development reviews, and other product development processes are effectively implemented.          Enable real-time visibility on project schedules and KPIs to management with dashboards and reports.          Must have strong technical understanding of the program, be articulate, effectively multi-task, stay on top of all aspects of program.          Manage customer and stakeholder expectations, effectively channel customer requirement to internal development teams and drive consensus on development schedule, plan, and processes.          Supports the adoption of processes by applying best practices and identifying and recommending process improvement opportunities within respective programs.          Manage Resources, Headcount, and Budget for the AI SW departments.                      Additional Requirements:              Passion about AI technology and its potential impact on the world.          Experience with end-to-end product integration          Experience managing software products through entire development life cycle.          Experience in 3rd party SW Program Management/development          Self-starter. Ability to manage, influence, and set the direction of multi-faceted, multi-disciplined teams and programs independently with minimal supervision.          Ability to articulate vision and influence decision-making and outcomes both within internal and with external teams through exceptional communication skills.                    Education:    Bachelors in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/ Electrical Engineering                          Work Experiences:            10+ years of experience in a combination of Software product development and program management in semiconductor/wireless industry      2+ years of direct experience / background in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Neural Network technology.      2+ years Engineering Lead/ Management experience with good exposure to operating budgets, resources, project financials.      2+ years Program Management experience or related work experience.      2+ years working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials.                    Minimum Qualifications:            Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.      2+ years of Program Management or related work experience.      1+ year of working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials.                    Preferred Qualifications                Education:        Masters in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Electrical Engineering/Business Administration              Work Experiences:          2+ years experience with program management tools such as dashboards, Gantt charts, etc.      3+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above).      2+ years experience working in a large matrixed organization.      7+ years Program Management experience or related work experience.          Certifications:    Project Management Professional (PMP) - Project Management Institute (PMI)        Skills:    Agile Scrum Project Management, Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Project, Prepare Budgets, Prepare Presentations

column1: Lead, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
column2: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Lead    will work with the Centre Head in India and will take regular guidance from Head of AI & ML at the World Economic Forum to define and progress the Projects        The Project Lead will collaborate across other thematic leads in India and C4IR network      The Project Lead is an individual contributor role however will get an opportunity to lead and work closely with fellows from industry partners, Government, interns and experts working with Centre either full time/ part time in virtual environment for the projects outcomes                  Duties and Responsibilities              The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Lead    will be developing and facilitating the engagement across the Forums communities of industry partners, Government institutions, research universities, start-up community, media, civil society organizations, social entrepreneurs.      The key responsibilities of project lead would be across project management, content management, coordination, administration and predominantly act as a catalyst and driving force for developing and defining action plans through comprehensive community engagement.              Curate a comprehensive national community eco system, establish specific value proposition for each community stake holder group of the proposed project by establishing a road map to future state from current state with clear next steps and timelines.          Conduct the landscape review, government and industry needs, define the high level outcomes and opportunities, project focus areas driven through AI and emerging technologies. The opportunities envisaged under core domains should be in alignment with the related national policies and the SDGs, benefits to larger community, Government, industry, start-ups, banking and insurance eco system and society.          Analyse India and global emerging technology innovations eco system especially AI/ML to address the challenges and capture the potential opportunities.          Facilitate informal dialogues and meetings to help build trust and coalesce stakeholders around common challenges          Curate insight products shedding light on emerging trends and challenges, benchmarking progress          Identify potential use cases in respective themes and evolve prioritization approach considering factors Alignment to SDGs, Measurable and non-measurable benefits for the larger community, Return on investments and affordability for user groups, Technology feasibility, Operations feasibility, Time frame of implementation, Potential risks          Prototype, test and iterate- Pilot and sandbox projects w/ government and industry partners to test governance, collect key learnings from pilot, Testing scenarios of data enablement and technology feasibility and analyze additional pilots undertaken by industry in country and across the globe.          Evidence based recommendations on framework and policy which can specifically be deployed by government and industry for scaled commercial deployment of use cases. Globally disseminate protocols and frameworks from successful pilots and support international adoption. The recommendations can either be one or combination of Standard operating procedures, Industry standards/norms, certifications, Government regulation, Incentive structures.                    Profile requirements            Passion for Impact- Perseverance, passion and the influence to improve the state of the world by building awareness and cooperation, shaping mind-sets and agendas and driving collective action in working through local challenges with sense of urgency.          Domain Knowledge - Comprehensive understanding of Artificial intelligence and interworking with other emerging technologies like IOT, Block chain etc in one or more of core verticals like Agriculture, healthcare, smart cities, education, manufacturing, energy etc. Understanding of challenges and opportunities, inclusivity issues, affordability requirements and regulations.          Technology depth- AI specialist with In-depth understanding of emerging technology implications in domains, overview of AI innovations and landscape of start up eco system, use cases, and technology maturity challenges for local adoption.          Technology Governance and Policy- Preferred experience and understanding of the Government regulation and policy landscape, Certifications, Incentive structures, Standard operating procedures, Industry standards/norms etc for AI and other emerging technologies adoption.          Comprehensive community mapping- Catalysing, curating and integrating community, managing equity stakes of each stake holder and regular feedback to realign to priorities          Execution Discipline- Preferred experience on shaping project vision and strategic planning, building project collateral, tracking dashboards, quarterly planning, monthly execution and weekly targets. Computer science with a focus on AI and policy would be preferred. column2: Marsh Mclennan is looking for a Stakeholder Relation and Process Improvement Manager      What can you expect? In this role, you will manage various complex multifaceted continuous improvement projects. Working with a large group of diverse stakeholders, Process Improvement Manager must be able to operate at a strategic level, while simultaneously being able to dive deep into the details of each program to drive results. What is in it for you? Being a part of a global team of professionals An opportunity to develop your career and technical skills within the wider global team Interact and contribute to team goals through global and regional colleague network  Contribute to revenue generation processes by interacting with internal and external teams and product specialists A great and competitive benefits package (locally dependant) An opportunity to learn and grow being a part of a global organisation We will count on you to: Manage engagement with stakeholders in the pacific region on various activities like release management, disaster recovery, patching and other support activities Act as escalation point for any support related issues Work with business leaders and stakeholder to identify opportunities for standardizing solutions and process/performance improvement. Able to develop and articulate a point of view on key global trends and how they impact clients. Define the overall scope of projects, create and maintain a consolidated timeline highlighting the major milestones and associated dates for project activities. Identify and communicate project dependencies and impacts. Ensure success criteria is defined upfront to promote alignment and actively manage to expected project outcomes. Create metrics, deployment goals, and objectives to drive accountability. Provides input and feedback to key leadership about process improvement opportunities. Ability to mediate and make pragmatic compromises especially in light of multiple Stakeholders competing for resources in order to meet their business deadlines. The role will need good project & stakeholder management skills to handle the complex dependency management and diverse stakeholders to deliver services on time and on strategy. What you need to have:  5+ years technical product support and project management experience.  Strong empathy for customers and you deliver customer support like you expect to receive it; with excellence.  Experience building strong internal and external relationships, with the ability to influence outcomes and leverage relationships  Four-year Computer Science degree or related degree, or deep relevant work experience.     What makes you stand out? A history of embracing and incubating emerging technology. Analytical, data driven, and process-oriented mindset. Not afraid to roll up the sleeves and go outside your comfort zone.   Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the worlds leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Companys 81,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries. With annual revenue over $19 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. For more information, visit mmc.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter or subscribe to  BRINK .

column2: As a Technical Program Manager, youwill be responsible for planning, leading, organizing, and motivating projectteams to achieve a high level of performance and quality in deliveringprojects     You will be responsible for managing parallel high-impact programsusing agile methods in a fast-paced environment that may cross multiplebusiness divisions           As a Technical Program Manager, you will play differentroles while:       Leading and managing large, complex organization-level projects consisting of multiple internal and/or external teams or using functional knowledge, situation awareness, and experience in blending traditional project management principles and practices with an Agile development approach to deliver large, complex, mission-critical, enterprise-level projects with the right balance of agility and predictability.       Playing a consultative role to help put in place the appropriate people, processes, and tools along with coaching team members to optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of the project team.       Acting as a scrum master for at least 3 highly dynamic agile teams that involve running all the key ceremonies strategic initiatives.       Building group program management capabilities that will help teams to be autonomous and also that could be set as an example for other departments or functions.         Knowledge, Skills,and Attributes:         Project Planning and Stakeholder Management - Define RACI, project scope, and timelines/milestones while focusing on regular and timely delivery of value; identify and manage project assumptions, risks issues; monitor manage project tasks and activities.      Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive levels; drive steer-co, kick-off, and working group meetings; prepare and distribute weekly project reports; identify and manage cross-team dependencies.       Scrum Master - Assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments, removing roadblocks to their work; leveraging organizational resources to improve capacity for project work; mentoring and developing team members; be a servant leader.        Product Owner Support - Support the Product Owner in grooming backlog, managing project scope, and setting customer expectations for project deliverables.       Process Management and Improvement - Define and manage a well-defined project management process and champion ongoing process improvement initiatives to implement best practices for Project Management; contribute to implementing an effective system of project governance that could be used by all departments or functions.       Roadmap Planning - Assist the team in properprioritization of the projects based on strategical objectives andorganizational goals; monitor the execution of the same ensuring they are met.                  Requirements:           8+ years of total experience as a Project/Program Manager managing large, complex projects in a high-tech development environment with multi-functional teams.       5+ years of experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with a proven track record of running 3 or more scrum teams in parallel or enterprise-level application development projects successfully implementing multiple software or web development projects using Agile methodologies.       Solid understanding of SDLC models as well as expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment.       Experience overseeing multi-function project teams including Developers, Product     Owners, Data Analysts, Designers, and QA Personnel.       Sufficient level of technical background to provide credible leadership to development teams and to be able to evaluate complex project risks and issues accurately and objectively.       PMP/CSM/PMI-ACP or equivalent certification is preferred, though not mandatory.       Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using appropriate project management tools such as Jira Confluence is a must.       Flexible to adapt to fast-paced environments multiple time zones.

Determine risks, develop mitigation strategies, and communicate information to internal and external key stakeholders.         Troubleshoot program issues and helps to develop alternative program tasks, schedules, milestones, resource plans, processes etc. to resolve program issues and conflicts.         Roll-up and reporting regularly to senior management on key product development milestones, metrics, risk mitigation plans and staffing status. Lead the development of processes and metrics by driving implementation of best project management practices to optimize team execution and deliverables quality.         Lead teams through the development process with attention to cultural priorities: collaboration, partnering, can do attitude.         Must be articulate, have a leadership presence, and be able to develop top quality presentations that are concise and engaging.         Must be able to multi-task and react to changing business needs with clear direction for subsequent action plans.               Minimum Qualifications:               Develops, defines, and executes plans of record, including, schedules, budgets, resources, deliverables, and risks.          Monitors and drives the program from initiation through delivery, interfacing with internal and external stakeholders across functions on technical matters, as needed.          Monitors on-time delivery, and achievement of program milestones. Represents the program and drives alignment across stakeholders.                 Principal Duties Responsibilities               Collaborates with key stakeholders and program sponsors to develop goals, set the prioritization of deliverables, and discuss necessary priorities and stakeholder needs.         Manages and takes responsibility for multiple small programs/technology with moderate complexity or a single complex program/technology by applying up-to-date program management knowledge to meet deadlines.         Develops and manages the execution of the program Plan of Record (e.g., on time, on budget, within scope) for multiple small programs or a single medium sized or complex programs/technologies which includes schedule and resource forecasting, stakeholder identification, method and frequency of communication, scope, and prioritization.         Tracks and manages all key metrics pertaining to a program and identifies when metrics deviate significantly from Plan of Record; escalates issues in a timely manner and proposes corrective actions.         Manages and prioritizes the work of the program team by establishing schedules, task assignments, and tracking tasks of team members.         Identifies program issues/risks and creates a risk mitigation plan for multiple small programs or a single medium sized or complex program. Maintains and updates the risk tracker.         Helps to promote program vision and objectives within own team, and ensures program objectives are met or exceeded.         Supports the adoption of processes by applying best practices and identifying and recommending process improvement opportunities within respective programs.               The Responsibilities Of This Role Include               Working independently with little supervision.         Using verbal and written communication skills to convey complex and/or detailed information to multiple individuals/audiences with differing knowledge levels. May require strong negotiation and influence, communication to large groups or high-level constituents.         Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions).         Completing tasks that do not have defined steps; simultaneous use of multiple mental abilities is generally required to determine the best approach; mistakes may result in significant rework.         Exercising substantial creativity to innovate new processes, procedures, or work products within guidelines or to achieve established objectives.         Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; advanced data analysis and interpretation skills are required.         Occasionally participates in strategic planning within own area affecting immediate operations.               Minimum Qualifications               Bachelor s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience         Overall 10+ yrs of Semiconductor Industry experience and minimum 3+ years of experience in a technical project management role         Must be experienced in complete ASIC lifecycle development including pre-silicon, silicon validation and IP development process         Must have strong interpersonal skills and be able to effectively communicate at all levels         Experience with Waterfall and Agile project management methodologies         Experience with project schedule and resource management tools, advanced Excel, power-point.                   Preferred Qualifications               Master s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience         Experience in managing global programs/teams across different time zones         Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence)         Ability to learn and adapt quickly         Detail and action oriented, self-starter, leader and motivator                   Educational Requirements                 Required: Bachelors, Computer Engineering and/or Computer Science and/or Electrical Engineering

column2: Job Title Strategic Program Manager Job  Summary  This is an exciting opportunity to support Accenture Legal to shape and deliver on some if it's highest priority initiatives. Working closely with the Legal Executive Committee (LEC) this role will involve managing one or many projects using the lastest Accenture programmatic methodologies to ensure successful on time, on budget delivery. Key Responsibilities The individual will be supporting the projects on several dimensions and is expected to dynamically prioritize this support as needed:  Strategy Development:Help shape and develop the overall strategy for Legal including the creation of any themes or pillar and associated initiatives to support execution.  Project Shaping & Planning:Undertake project shaping and planning to ensure there is clarity in how milestones will be met and who is responsible for what activities.  Project Reporting & Governance:Create a structure to evaluate success, share information and make decisions  Programme Management (PM):Delivery of project management activities and ensure that milestones are met.  Communications:Ensure clear Communication and Stakeholder Engagement using different channels, as appropriate, to ensure stakeholders are informed and engaged as they should be. Qualification Qualifications and Experience Required The following elements are required:  Minimum of five years working experience in fast-paced project-based roles, be that consulting to external clients (e.g. in Strategy, Consulting or Digital) and/or working on strategic internal initiatives (e.g. in AEE).  Proven track record of supporting senior client or internal stakeholders in variety of scoping, planning, execution and monitoring activities.  Experience of working across multiple geographic borders and time zones.  Demonstrable ability to define a project approach and identify the key factors and constraints; knowledge and competence in identifying risks, issues and dependencies.  Fluency in Microsoft Office packages (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) The following elements are preferred:  Demonstrable knowledge of FORM and application to practical examples. The following elements are helpful:  Knowledge of operating model, talent strategy, L&D, change management, communications and culture frameworks.  Exposure to data analytics, including modelling and visualization.  Exposure to innovation management Skills Required  Strong evaluation and problem-solving skills:able to identify the real issue, and to anticipate requirements and potential consequences.  Logical reasoning:able to demonstrate rationale behind any recommendations and achieve consensus around proposed outcomes  Outstanding spoken and written communication skills:able to deal confidently, tactfully and appropriately with people of different disciplines and at all levels of the organization  Strong influencing and negotiation skills:able to build strong relationships with multiple global stakeholders quickly via virtual tools; listen, understand and respond to any concerns.  Prioritization skills:Comfortable working within a large and complex environment with multiple stakeholders and interest groups.  Task management:Professional and organized approach to delivery. Able to work under pressure and to tight timescales, with minimal supervision. Personal Qualities Required  Strategic thinking and innovation:Able to think strategically but also willing and able to roll their sleeves up and do whatever is needed to achieve key business objectives, diving into detail where necessary.  Influence and communication:Able to be highly credible and persuasive, influencing key stakeholders and effecting change with or without direct reporting authority.  Collaboration:Able to work well with others, to build strong relationships, to share knowledge and expertise to foster a sense of trust.  Drive:Commitment to getting things done, including self-sufficiency and the lack of need for detailed direction.  Flexibility:Ability to manage diary and working pattern to enable more interactions with global stakeholders.  Resilience:Able to manage emotions and take steps to manage workplace frustrations constructively; remaining calm and positive under pressure. Application Documentation  Customized CV  Covering Letter

column2: As a Technical Program Manager (TPM) at      End     -User Computing Division, Broadcom     , you will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our projects and programs.              You will      be responsible for     overseeing the planning, execution, and delivery of complex technical initiatives and product releases within our organization.              Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will ensure alignment with business      objectives     , drive efficient execution, and      maintain     high-quality standards throughout the project lifecycle.              This role demands a combination of technical      expertise     , project management skills, and leadership capabilities to navigate through the dynamic landscape of      Omnissas     products and services.                               Responsibilities:                       Lead the success of one or multiple      End-User Computing Division, Broadcom     s products, services, and engineering initiatives across various geographical regions.                 Serve as the authoritative and trusted leader of a software delivery team      comprised     of Product Managers, Development, Quality Engineering, and other functional units to execute release plans, ensuring adherence to schedules, dependencies, and risk management.                 Utilize your technical acumen and product      expertise     to proactively      identify     risks, issues, and drive their resolution.                 Drive continuous transformation of the release process, leaving your mark on the products under your management.                 Independently and accurately report the state of your releases/initiatives to executives and other stakeholders.                 Act as the reliable spokesperson on the state of releases/initiatives during key checkpoint reviews.                 Oversee the transition of your release deliverables to the live environment post-driving legal compliance and launch activities.                               Requirements:                       bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.                 Minimum of 3 years of prior program and/or project management experience in enterprise software.                 Solid grasp of project management principles with a dedication to delivering high-performance, quality software.                 3-4 years of hands-on experience in software development.                 Exceptional skills in influencing, teamwork, and delivering solutions within complex and ambiguous environments.                 Ability to take full ownership of releases/initiatives and drive them to completion.                 Proficiency     in software development and project/program management fundamentals, including the software development lifecycle, quality processes, scoping, costs, schedules, deliverables, change and risk management, and mitigation.                 Familiarity with agile frameworks and SaaS product delivery.                 Excellent oral and written communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills.                 Outstanding organizational, prioritization, and multitasking abilities.                 Adaptability to change and comfort     able         working     in high-paced, ambiguous environments.                               Preferred Skills:                       General knowledge of Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, etc), build and release tools.                 Understanding and knowledge of Continuous Delivery processes.                 Project Management Certification or Certified Scrum Master certification.

column2: About Role: Program Manager Program Manager is responsible for planning and overseeing projects to ensure they are completed in time and  within budget. PMO plans and designates project resources, prepares budgets, monitors progress, and keeps  stakeholders updated. PMO ensures they prepare and implement the weekly / monthly review calendars,  conducting KRA reviews, updating the balanced score card, conducting internal process audits and publishing  results to stake holders.   You'll be Responsible For? Determine and define project scope and objectives   Prepare budget based on scope of work and resource requirements   Track project costs in order to meet budget   Develop and manage a detailed project schedule and work plan   Provide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and  progress   Manage contracts with vendors and suppliers by assigning tasks and communicating expected deliverables   Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout entire project execution Measure project performance to identify areas for improvement and monitor progress   You'd have ?  Bachelor's degree in computer science   7-12 years of project management and related experience   Good experience with JIRA  Usage, Administration, Dashboard/Report Generation. Preferably in Product companies within the IT ecosystem   Project Management Professional (PMP), Prince2, Scrum Master (CSM) certifications preferred   Proven ability to solve problems creatively   Strong familiarity with project management software tools, methodologies, and best practices   Experience seeing projects through the full life cycle   Excellent analytical skills   Strong interpersonal skills and extremely resourceful   Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline  Why join us?  We thought you would never ask! We offer all the usual stuff: competitive salary, flexible working hours,  challenging product culture but the real perks are:  ??Challenging and fun work environment solving meaningful real-life business problems - you will  never have a boring day at the office.  ??World-class team who love solving tough problems and have a bias for action. Tanla is an equal opportunity employer.  We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of  race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. www.tanla.com

column2: Phenom is seeking a Technical Program Manager to join our Global Customer Care Organization. You will be reporting to the Director, Global Customer Care. This position is essential to the success of the newly live Phenom customers.            ?       What you'll Do                You will be dynamic, passionate about technology and customer success.          You will be the primary point of contact for GCC stakeholders throughout implementation, owning all facets of service delivery - including planning, requirements gathering, resource and budget management, risk management, governance and stakeholder management - ultimately driving the success of the implementation of assigned programs.          You will be the trusted advisor to your customers, you will maintain a holistic view of their end to end solution, ensuring optimal setup for maximum value realization. Through a series of discovery workshops you will advise on and validate technical setup (eg integrations, SSO, domains/subdomains etc). You will also consult on functional configuration, bringing in subject matter experts from across GCC where needed..          Finally, you will track and communicate project performance to all stakeholders (internal and external), ensuring that deliverables are managed within appropriate risk tolerance levels.          You will ensure all aspects of a Golive Clients onboarding with Support are successful and on track with the goals of the project          You will ensure a smooth support onboarding for our customers by consolidating, evaluating Customers Readiness checklists, configurations and customizations in the implemented solution.          You will partner with our Implementation and Customer Support leaders to help our customers efficiently adopt the product and support services during the transition phase from Implementation.          You will participate in the Hypercare program advising the teams on the best way to address platform stability issues.          Evaluate, Report and Recommend the solutions for Customer Support teams to fix the production issues during Hypercare.          Identify the patterns and gap analysis to set our customer s up for success and translate them into Standard Operating Procedures for scalability.            What you've Done:            ?         A minimum of 4 years hands-on technical program management experience including designing solutions for enterprise environments. Must have led implementation activities for a technical product.          High-level understanding of Cloud Computing and hosted applications          High-level consulting experience, both in terms of business processes and technical SaaS software setup          Knowledge of Project Management Methodology and Software Development Life Cycles including Agile and Waterfall          Understanding of Common Web Technologies including SaaS platforms, CMS technologies, Java, HTML, XML, APIs, JavaScript, and CSS.          Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills to effectively communicate technical and business issues (and solutions) to diverse audience.          Proven track record in delivering multiple software product implementations simultaneously          Experience in Talent Acquisition/Human Resources technology a real plus          Ability and flexibility to work in a fast pace environment with minimal supervision            Benefits:            We want you to be your best self and to pursue your passions!          Health and we'llness benefits/programs to support holistic employee health          Flexible hours and working schedules, as we'll as parental leave for new parents          Growing organization with career pathing and development opportunities          Tons of perks and extras in every location for all Phenoms

column2: We are hiring a customer-focused, technically proficient Senior Technical Program Manager to build internal tools within SCHIE organization to drive efficiency and scalability. You should be passionate about engaging closely with our internal customers and engineering teams, understanding their needs, prioritizing, and translating this into a clear product roadmap.          You will partner closely with other Technical Program Managers and peer engineering teams to drive vision and deliver our internal customer needs, including system performance, efficiency, scale, and functionality. Your ability to communicate clearly, collaborate across teams, drive for results, and influence without authority will be critical tools in delivering great results amidst complex, ever-changing requirements from the organization.                            ?         Required Qualifications              Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Masters degree preferred) with a minimum of 6 years of experience.          Proven expertise in technical program management or comparable roles, particularly focusing on software development projects.          Strong comprehension of software development methodologies, particularly Agile and Scrum.          Exceptional communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management capabilities.          Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies like Jira, Azure DevOps, or equivalent platforms.          Possession of an analytical mindset for solving intricate problems and making data-informed decisions.          Demonstrated experience in leading cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration towards shared objectives and taking end-to-end ownership.          Preferred certifications include PMP, ScrumMaster, or Product Owner.              Preferred Qualifications              Ability to quickly acquire and excel in relevant technical domains related to assigned responsibilities.          Having a growth mindset to continuously learn, develop, and catalyze innovation.          Proficiency in independent work and swift adaptation to unfamiliar territories.          Strong communication aptitude and inclination to engage in cross-functional teamwork.          Demonstrated success in executing software or web development projects utilizing Agile frameworks.          Capacity to navigate ambiguity and tackle intricate challenges.          Effective organization and analysis of data to derive insights.              Tasks                      The position entails collaborating with Hardware, Firmware, and Software Engineering teams at SCHIE to comprehend their requirements for data analytics, AI/ML applications, and internal tools, with a focus on enhancing daily operations efficiency and scalability.          Conduct thorough analysis of business and technical requirements, collaborating with stakeholders to prioritize and align with project goals.          Working alongside the Software engineering team, you will be responsible for defining the technical strategy and product roadmap for internal customers.          Collaborate closely with technical teams to propose and evaluate innovative solutions, considering factors like feasibility, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.          Act as a liaison for clarifying requirements and facilitating communication between stakeholders and development teams.          Coordinate end-to-end project schedules, including semester plans, milestones, timelines, and releases, ensuring adherence to established processes.          Organize and conduct regular demos to gather feedback and incorporate it into product iterations.          Interact with business users to triage, prioritize, and address feedback within your domain.          Define success criteria and foster relationships for implementing features in complex cross-functional projects, ensuring alignment across organizations.

column2: VLSI Operations Manager with SoC Design Knowledge          We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced VLSI (Very Large-Scale Integration) Operations Manager with in-depth knowledge of SoC (System on Chip) design to lead our operations team.          The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of VLSI operations, including project management, resource allocation, and process optimization, with a focus on SoC design and development.          This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive innovation and excellence in semiconductor manufacturing while managing a team of talented engineers and technicians.          Key Responsibilities:      1. Project Management: Lead and manage VLSI projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to project schedules, budgets, and quality standards. Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including design, verification, layout, and testing, to drive project success.      2. Resource Allocation: Allocate resources, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to support VLSI operations and meet project deliverables. Optimize resource utilization and capacity planning to maximize efficiency and productivity.      3. Process Optimization: Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization in VLSI operations, including design methodologies, tools, and workflows. Implement best practices and continuous improvement initiatives to enhance productivity and quality.      4. SoC Design Knowledge: Utilize in-depth knowledge of SoC design principles, architectures, and methodologies to guide and support VLSI design teams. Provide technical leadership and mentorship to ensure successful execution of SoC projects.      5. Quality Assurance: Establish and maintain quality assurance processes and standards for VLSI operations, with a focus on SoC design quality and reliability. Implement quality control measures and perform regular audits to ensure compliance with industry standards and customer requirements.      6. Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks and challenges in VLSI operations, including technical, schedule, and resource-related risks. Develop contingency plans and proactive strategies to minimize project disruptions and ensure on-time delivery.      7. Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, technicians, and support staff to achieve departmental goals and objectives. Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning to drive professional growth and development.                  Minimum Qualifications:          Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.    4+ years of Program Management or related work experience.    3+ years of working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials.                Qualifications:      - Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree or MBA is preferred.    - 8+ years of proven experience in VLSI operations management, with a strong background in SoC design and development.    - 5+ years of expertise in project management methodologies, tools, and techniques. PMP certification is a plus.    - Deep understanding of SoC design principles, architectures, and methodologies, including RTL design, synthesis, and verification.    - Familiarity with EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tools and CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software used in VLSI design.    - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and drive effective solutions.    - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.    - Proven leadership and team-building abilities, with a track record of successfully managing and motivating teams to achieve results.

Ltd. is one of India s fastest-growing entertainment networks and a house of iconic brands that offers multi-platform, multi-generational, and multicultural brand experiences. Viacom18 defines entertainment in India by touching the lives of people through its properties on air, online, on the ground, in cinemas, and merchandise. Its portfolio of 38 channels across general entertainment, movies, sports, youth, music, and kids genres delights consumers across the country with its eclectic mix of programming. JioCinema, Viacom18 s OTT platform, is one of India s leading streaming services and most popular destination for live sports. Viacom18 Studios has successfully produced and distributed iconic Hindi films and clutter-breaking regional films for over 13 years in India.

column2: Requirement   Program Manager- Content Operations  Business   Unit  upGrad Abroad/ Company   Website  https://www.upgradabroad.com/ Location  Noida, Sector 125 Years   of   Experience  1 - 5 Years Description  As an Manager- Program Operations at upGrad Abroad, you will play a crucial role in managing various educational programs and ensuring an exceptional learning experience for our students. You will be responsible for overseeing multiple facets of program management, including website management, the introduction of new programs, team leadership, and cross-functional collaboration. Additionally, you will serve as the primary point of contact for our university partners and manage payment processes to facilitate a seamless experience for our customers. Responsibilities     Team   Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of program coordinators and support staff to ensure efficient operations and achievement of program goals. Provide guidance, training, and support to team members to enhance their performance and professional development.   Program   Management: Oversee the launch and management of multiple educational programs, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and timelines. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to define program requirements, objectives, and deliverables Monitor program progress, identify potential risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful outcomes. Continuously evaluate program effectiveness and implement improvements to enhance the learning experience.   Website   Management: Coordinate with the marketing and tech teams to manage the company's website, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information about programs, courses, and offerings. Work closely with web developers to implement changes and enhancements to improve user experience and accessibility.   Introduction   of   New   Programs: Collaborate with product development teams to conceptualize, plan, and launch new educational programs based on market research and industry trends. Develop comprehensive launch plans, including marketing strategies, pricing models, and target audience analysis.   Cross-Functional   Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, product development, and customer support, to ensure seamless coordination and alignment of activities. Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among team members to achieve shared goals and objectives.   Customer   Experience   Enhancement: Identify opportunities to enhance the customer experience and satisfaction throughout the learning journey. Collect feedback from students and implement improvements to address their needs and preferences Ensure timely resolution of customer inquiries, complaints, and issues to maintain high levels of satisfaction and loyalty.   University   Partner   Relations: Serve as the primary point of contact for university partners, fostering strong relationships and effective communication channels. Collaborate with university representatives to ensure alignment of program objectives, curriculum design, and quality standards. Facilitate ongoing collaboration and partnership initiatives to strengthen mutual goals and outcomes.   Payment   Management: Oversee the payment processes for educational programs, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with financial policies and regulations. Coordinate with finance and accounting teams to reconcile payments, invoices, and financial records. Address payment-related inquiries and issues from students, partners, and internal stakeholders in a timely and professional manner. Proven experience in program management, preferably in the education or e-learning industry.  Strong leadership and team management skills, with a demonstrated ability to inspire and motivate teams towards achieving common goals.  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively interact with diverse stakeholders.  Solid understanding of website management principles and experience with content management systems (CMS) and web analytics tools.  Analytical mindset with the ability to gather and analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions to improve program performance.  Familiarity with project management methodologies, tools, and techniques.  Experience in managing customer relations and delivering exceptional customer service.  Knowledge of higher education industry trends, online learning platforms, and instructional design principles is desirable.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and project management software.

column2: The Technical Program Manager for Platform Releases is responsible for overseeing the planning, scheduling, and execution of Platform releases for the company's platform     This role involves coordination across multiple teams, ensuring that all aspects of the release are aligned with the release scoping, and managing release schedule risks and dependencies     The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development, project management, and a proven track record of leading successful Product Platform releases           What You Will Do:         Release Planning and Coordination: Develop and maintain a release calendar in collaboration with product management and all engineering teams. Cross-Functional Leadership: Lead cross-functional teams comprising developers, release engineers, documentation, Product Marketing, Go-to-market team and other stakeholders to ensure smooth and timely delivery of releases. Act as a point of coordination between different teams and departments.     Risk Management: Identify potential risks and dependencies early in the release cycle. Develop and implement mitigation strategies to ensure that releases are not impacted.     Process Improvement: Continuously assess and improve the release management process to increase efficiency, reduce risks, and enhance quality.     Stakeholder Communication: Keep all stakeholders informed about the progress, risks, and changes in the release schedule. Prepare and present regular status reports via emails and channels to all stakeholders.     Quality Excellence: Work closely with the release teams to ensure that releases meet quality standards. Oversee the development, triaging and execution of test plans.            What You Will Bring:         Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.       6+ years of experience in software development, project management, or a related field, with a proven track record of managing successful platform releases.     Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.     Excellent cross functional leadership and team management skills.     Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to manage multiple releases and priorities in a fast-paced environment.            What Gives You an Edge:         Masters degree in a related field.       Certifications in project management (e.g., PMP, Agile Certified Practitioner).     Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices.     Technical expertise in the platform being released.     Experience in reliability engineering.
