column2: Best In-class Benefits     Inclusive Leadership     Reimagining Healthcare     Competitive Pay     Supportive Reporting Relation                                     Description:                             The Senior Principal Engineering Program Manager within Cybersecurity s MIS will lead the Identity and Access Lifecycle Management (IALM) service within Identity and Access Management     This leadership role will work hand in hand with Engineering leadership and peer Program Management at the Providence Global Center and in the US to drive forward an enterprise wide, highly visible Identity Governance Administration program     In partnership with key stakeholders, you will focus on implementing enterprise-wide processes and solutions to mature Providence s identity management solution, develop strategies and roadmaps, manage, and maintain the health of the IALM environment to progress the programs strategic direction                            What will you be responsible for                             Act as the Cybersecurity (CYBR) liaison for Providence businesses/entities, integrate security into business/entity scope, strategy, programs, and operations.                         Manage and coordinate cross functionality across security teams and stakeholders to successfully deliver Identity and Access Lifecycle Management (IALM) capabilities.                         Drive critical IALM workstreams ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements and continuing to progress the programs strategic direction.                         Ensure IALM goals align with the mission and goals of Identity and Access Management                         Formulate, organize, and monitor inter-connected projects/programs and associated workstreams.                         Decide and deliver suitable short-term and long-term objectives.                         Manage program and product issues, risks, and changes to ensure goals are achieved.                         Deliver issues and risk tracking and resolution, decision logs, communication plans and other program documentation.                         Engage with stakeholders to make communication easy and transparent.                         Deliver change management and communication strategies.                         Establish and monitor program metrics and evaluation methods to assess strengths, identify opportunities of improvement as well as timely reporting of program throughout its lifecycle.                         Prepare and present reports for program sponsors and executive leaders.                         Resolve program scope issues and deadlines.                          Lead efforts to define epics, features, and create user stories, ensuring delivery of business value.                         Act as a coach, mentor, and role model to other program managers and engineering teams                         Support and guide others in working in a global service delivery model.                            What would your day look like?                           Develop and drive PMO engagement within security programs and services in alignment with its strategic plans and objectives with little/no oversight from leadership.                         While operating independently, work collaboratively with business/entity operational leadership, intake, and governance teams, as well as Cybersecurity teams required to deploy security services and technologies.                         Ensure optimum and efficient delivery of security services and issue/risk management to business/entity programs and operations.                         Advise, consult, and manage several complex projects under a common objective at Providence, under a single program (or across several programs) designed to support Providence to achieve Cybersecurity vision and priorities.                          Work with and facilitate processes to accomplish complex program objectives, manage change, and resolve issues that span across project teams and departments by planning, organizing, directing, and supervising program activities in a cost-effective and productive manner to achieve customer satisfaction.                          Engage and organize the assignment of activities of multi-functional, large-scale teams, as well as the project estimates, task dependencies and schedule.                         Proactively and independently manage stakeholder expectations for timelines and deliverables throughout the program/project lifecycle with little/no intervention from business/entity leadership.                         Influence decisions in partnership with CYBR leadership to ensure work toward common objectives.                         Proactively inform and influence others to maintain the balance required between business needs; CYBR strategy and priorities; and financial requirements and budgets with little/no direction from business/entity leadership.                         Maintain all program/project artifacts and set the standards for other program/project management resources on the program(s).                         Pro-actively and independently develop root cause analyses and process improvement plans.                         Communicate and summarize status of security programs and services, and progress toward major initiatives to leadership as well as to direct and indirect reports.                         Partner with the IS leadership team in various areas such as strategy, architecture, programs, policies, critical infrastructure and applications, and Healthcare.                         Drive accountable areas for results. Take ownership of the environment, teams, operations, initiatives, and projects within areas of accountability, sometimes in ambiguous circumstances.                         Develop and drive continuous improvement initiatives, organizing necessary resources with little/no intervention from business/entity leadership.                             Who are we looking for                             4-year University (Bachelors) degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or STEM fields, or equivalent experience.                         12+ years of Information Systems experience. 7+ years of Program/Project Management experience, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience.                            Preferred few years of Project Portfolio Management Office (PPMO) experience within a Healthcare, Pharma or Bio-Technology organization.                             Strong communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate (coherent, completeness, logical) to executive leaders and individual team members, catering their message accordingly.                           Ability to manage programs with the highest complexity and broadest breadth - typically at the enterprise-level.                         Ability to coordinate and facilitate between executive leadership, resource managers of all IS teams, project management and consulting resources.                           Thorough understanding of PM practices; strong Agile experience, knowledge and expertise. Preferred knowledge of ADO.                           Working knowledge of Information Security, Data Privacy, and Security Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) concepts and technologies.                                       Preferred Project/Program Management (PMP, PgMP, etc.), Agile Scrum (PSM I, PMI-ACP, SAFe SSM, etc.) certifications.

column2: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING          We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry,  our communities,  and the world.  Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences   the building blocks for the data center,  artificial intelligence,  PCs,  gaming and embedded.  Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture.  We push the limits of innovation to solve the world s most important challenges.  We strive for execution excellence while being direct,  humble,  collaborative,  and inclusive of diverse perspectives.          AMD together we advance_          Sr.  Program Manager                         SUMMARY ROLE DESCRIPTION:          Sr Technical Program Manager for the S3 (Strategic Silicon Solutions) SOC team.  In this role,  you will be primarily responsible for ensuring that new product development program execution is successfully driven in line with the project(s) scope,  schedule,  and budget.      The candidate must have a strong understanding of the general silicon engineering process,  from concept to tape-out to production.       A key component of this role involves working closely with AMD and third-party IP suppliers,  an SOC team spread across the globe and the SOC architecture team to     ensure continual forward progress is maintained,  status reporting is timely and accurate,  and key issues are driven with appropriate urgency.  This is a cross-functional role that involves engagement across all engineering disciplines and business units to meet project objectives.  This position offers deep exposure to industry leading CPUs,  Graphics,  GPU Compute,  Machine Learning,  and related technologies.                   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:          Delivering on all assigned program commitments from   inception   through   execution to tapeout & production        Resolving cross-domain dependencies and enabling progress to meet planned schedule        Delivering assigned program(s) within POR schedule,  budget and scope        Driving program scoping & development cost roll up for a given budget,  customer requirements & SOC bounding box.          Acting as a key liaison between IP and SOC execution teams on all matters pertaining to successful project execution,  IP delivery and negotiation        Driving incorporation of initiatives and process improvements at the functional,  cross-functional,  and corporate level into assigned program(s)        Ownership of   status reporting and issue messaging to key   stakeholders,  including senior executives and customers.                 REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:          Around ~20+ years program management or technical leadership experience in SOC execution.  Minimum 5 years of strong experience in SOC program management and end-to-end SOC execution.       Ability to scope a SOC program end to end   resource/HC,  complexity,  effort,  milestones,  schedule and cost.       Strong presentation,  communication,  and leadership skills; ability to lead technical discussions and up-level outcomes for executive-level status reporting.       Knowledge of end-to-end Silicon and/or systems development process        Strong knowledge on Silicon engineering functions like Design,  DFT,  DV,  PD.         Experience in managing complex,  interrelated ASIC projects,  programs,  and functions; working   knowledge across multiple engineering disciplines is highly desirable.       Ability to work in a large matrixed organization and achieve results via influence        Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.      Strong interpersonal and stakeholders management skills.         Highly organized,  able to prioritize,  and juggle multiple work streams to tight deadlines      Proven ability to multi-task effectively and manage competing priorities      Expert on scrum and agile methods of program execution.         Leader with strong self-driving ability and winning attitude.          Experience working in a high-pressure environment and competing priorities and tight turnaround times         Experience with Microsoft Project,  JIRA,  Confluence and Excel is an asset         Experience with Agile methodology                 ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:            Around ~20+ years program management or technical leadership experience in SOC execution. column2: We are looking for a Program Manager to fill a need within the fast-paced Procurement Operations team, specifically the Hardware Procurement and Cloud procurement and contract execution and controls      This team supports procurement business needs to facilitate growth of Microsoft s cloud infrastructure, including - managing Purchase Order (PO) requisitions per SLA to support customer requirements while delivering high quality service through customer obsession, quality control of MyOrder purchase orders (POs), reviewing and routing contracts, procurement process education, network PO creation, supplier onboarding, and assisting project owners in efficiently navigating the procurement process, while enforcing both corporate and business group purchasing policies to mitigate risk to Microsoft      We are looking for a high energy Program Manager who is passionate about operations while solving complex business optimization problems on a scale      Additionally, this team routinely drives strategic initiatives to improve processes and mitigate risk within the operations space      Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Supply Chain, Data Analytics, Business, Finance or related field AND 2+ years experience (including internships) in Data Science/Analytics, Finance, Project Management, Supply Chain, and/or Operations            o OR equivalent experience      6+ years minimum experience working with BI reporting tools, knowledge of relational databases.            Preferred:              Demonstrate excellent communication, written, presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills.        Previous experience working in Sourcing, Procurement, Contract Management etc.        Strong analytical and organizational skills with advanced level expertise in Excel, Power BI/Power Platform tools and basic knowledge on relational databases.        Demonstrated ability to motivate self and others.        Ability to mentor and coach others        Strong written and oral communication skills along with desire and ability to communicate with business leaders through all levels of the organization.        Able to maintain a broader perspective and identifies and evaluates opportunities to enhance the business through cross-group collaboration.        Experience driving improvements or process enhancements based on data insights.        Ability to maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high demand environment.        Good attitude and flexibility in changing circumstances with cross regional collaboration.    Strong Customer-focus and attention to detail.        If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .        We are looking for a high energy Operations Program Manager who is passionate about operations while solving complex business optimization problems on a scale.      Our desired individual will have excellent organizational and communication skills, ability to navigate ambiguity, manage large volumes of work while possessing the skills to quickly communicate with stakeholders and identify priorities.        As an Operations Program Manager, you will work with a local team of vendors, improve existing processes via automation or process engineering and proactively mitigate potential risks to the business.        You will support the Operations team that is accountable for:        Ensure that all necessary data is included in every PO and POs are submitted timely to meet SLAs Resolve all PO exceptions.        Review and ensure all POs are submitted on time.        Create manual POs, as needed.        Prioritize POs and work with approvers and their business teams to drive timely approvals on high priority POs.        Create and maintain tools and reports to fill system gaps and enable      Procurement processes and other supporting processes.    Provide operational support to various teams that rely on Purchase Order data.      This includes -receiving and invoicing issues, process requirements, or general inquiries and clarifications.    Partner with various Business Groups, Engineering teams, Regional Operations Centers, Data Center Operations, Finance, Strategic Suppliers and many more organizations to ensure our program is improving and executing operational solutions that enables scalable growth of data center deployments, as well as sustaining support for those deployments.        Driving next generation workflow automation, allowing Cloud Infrastructure to scale at a pace required to support the business.        Develop and maintain trusting stakeholder relationships across Operations, Business, Engineering and Supplier stakeholders.        Ability to perform root cause analysis for PO blockers and driving process improvements to reduce cycle time and cost savings.        Must be comfortable working with ambiguity and be adept at using data to influence decision making.        Create user resources and guidance, develop process documentation, and deliver training.        Perform in-depth analysis to identify key business risks and opportunities and make recommendations.        Identify themes within each of your areas of execution and be able to influence engineering effectively to improve the support or program experience for partners.

column2: Job Title Strategic Program Manager Organizational References Career Level:Manager (CL7) Career Track:Corporate Functions Legal Unit:Legal Operations (Strategic Programme & Operations Management team) Reporting to:Global Strategic Programme & Operations Management Lead Talent Segment:Program, Project, and Service Management Role:Strategic Program Manager Specialty:Project & Programme Management Job Characteristics Full-time Office based for majority of time, but some opportunities for flexible working. Typical office environment for meetings. Less than 10% of the time spent on international travel. Organizational Context Accenture Legal encompasses ~2800 lawyers, contract management and other professionals in 46 countries, making us amongst the biggest in-house units of our kind globally. Legal Operations (Legal Ops) provides services to other Legal functions that improve their day-to-day efficiency and effectiveness, facilitate change and control costs. This Strategic Program Manager role is part of the Strategic Programme Management & Operations team within Legal Ops. Job  Summary This is an exciting opportunity to support Accenture Legal to shape and deliver on some if it's highest priority initiatives. Working closely with the Legal Executive Committee (LEC) this role will involve managing one or many projects using the lastest Accenture programmatic methodologies to ensure successful on time, on budget delivery. Key Relationships Reports to:Global Strategic Programme Management Lead Key Relationships: LEC Strategic Program & Operation team members Head of Legal Operations Key Responsibilities The individual will be supporting the projects on several dimensions and is expected to dynamically prioritize this support as needed: Strategy Development:Help shape and develop the overall strategy for Legal including the creation of any themes or pillar and associated initiatives to support execution. Project Shaping & Planning:Undertake project shaping and planning to ensure there is clarity in how milestones will be met and who is responsible for what activities.  Project Reporting & Governance:Create a structure to evaluate success, share information and make decisions Programme Management (PM):Delivery of project management activities and ensure that milestones are met. Communications:Ensure clear Communication and Stakeholder Engagement using different channels, as appropriate, to ensure stakeholders are informed and engaged as they should be. Qualification Qualifications and Experience Required The following elements are required: Minimum of five years working experience in fast-paced project-based roles, be that consulting to external clients (e.g. in Strategy, Consulting or Digital) and/or working on strategic internal initiatives (e.g. in AEE). Proven track record of supporting senior client or internal stakeholders in variety of scoping, planning, execution and monitoring activities. Experience of working across multiple geographic borders and time zones. Demonstrable ability to define a project approach and identify the key factors and constraints; knowledge and competence in identifying risks, issues and dependencies. Fluency in Microsoft Office packages (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) The following elements are preferred: Demonstrable knowledge of FORM and application to practical examples. The following elements are helpful: Knowledge of operating model, talent strategy, L&D, change management, communications and culture frameworks. Exposure to data analytics, including modelling and visualization. Exposure to innovation management Skills Required Strong evaluation and problem-solving skills:able to identify the real issue, and to anticipate requirements and potential consequences. Logical reasoning:able to demonstrate rationale behind any recommendations and achieve consensus around proposed outcomes Outstanding spoken and written communication skills:able to deal confidently, tactfully and appropriately with people of different disciplines and at all levels of the organization Strong influencing and negotiation skills:able to build strong relationships with multiple global stakeholders quickly via virtual tools; listen, understand and respond to any concerns. Prioritization skills:Comfortable working within a large and complex environment with multiple stakeholders and interest groups. Task management:Professional and organized approach to delivery. Able to work under pressure and to tight timescales, with minimal supervision. Personal Qualities Required Strategic thinking and innovation:Able to think strategically but also willing and able to roll their sleeves up and do whatever is needed to achieve key business objectives, diving into detail where necessary. Drive:Commitment to getting things done, including self-sufficiency and the lack of need for detailed direction. Flexibility:Ability to manage diary and working pattern to enable more interactions with global stakeholders. Resilience:Able to manage emotions and take steps to manage workplace frustrations constructively; remaining calm and positive under pressure. Application Documentation Customized CV Covering Letter

column2: The Sr. Manager - Operations, is a member of Operations team at the country office. This position will report directly to the Program Operations Director. The Sr. Manager Operations will directly assist the Program Operations Director in ensuring smooth operations at the field level (Chhattisgarh, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh), and will be directly supervising the Field Managers to accomplish the operations department goals. The Sr. Manager Operations will also be instrumental in coordinating with other departments at CO and GO level. This position also involves frequent travelling to the field offices, as well as regular interaction with the education officials, partners, school administrators, teacher and students.           Roles and Responsibilities:            Management, Planning and Coordination:         Develop a good understanding of all RtR programs, their inter-linkages in view of the convergence, including GEP.         Demonstrates a strong background in project management, encompassing planning, monitoring, and evaluating programs at all levels across multiple states, preferable education projects.         Lead the efforts to create a tracker of the states allocated and update it regularly, including procurement.         Coordinating and following up with the allocated state teams and admin. department on various reports, ICs, and budget related issues.         Providing support to OPs team in tracking ICs and corresponding expenses at the state level, while working closely with the allocated state teams.         Possesses strong financial management expertise, including annual planning, budgeting, budget outlook, cash forecasting, and the ability to analyze and track budgets for various programs. Compiling and interpreting financial data, with the ability to identify instances of both under-spending and overspending.         Coordinate with other program teams for timely redressal and mitigation of various operational issues.         Coordinating with RM&E will study the analysis of Literacy and GEP data trends, identifying potential risks and deviations in implementation of program design. Will also look for and report the ineffective /inconsistent processes at field levels, and process improvement.         Communicate and correspond with GO counterparts to seek highlight issues and seek clarification on various aspects of operations in the country.         Helps developing systems to keep record of the all the PNGOs, and state level partnerships, do follow ups for the timely renewal of the partnership documents (agreements/MoUs).         Innovate and create systems with POD that are easily adaptable at the field level, to increase operational efficiency of the organization.         Identify implementation challenges, provide solutions or flag to Program Operations Director (POD) for redressal.         Second line to the POD and represent POD in various meetings as and when required.         Coordinate with the other departments - Finance, Admin, GEP and LP.         Ensure smooth process flow of events.         Collaborate with Field Managers of the allocated states and conduct Operations call on monthly basis.         Participate in ToT of Literacy Program and Social Mobilizer training (SM) of GEP Program.             Operation System Design:         Help create systems to monitor operations in the allocated states besides keeping the IC s updated. This may include, but not limited to, creation of calendars, trackers, toolkits, frameworks etc., with the help of concerned department.         Responsible for improving operational efficiency on the field, by providing timely inputs, and improvement support at the state level through the help of state managers.         Provide assistance and inputs to RM&E on need basis regarding improvement of process and program outcome monitoring.         Coordinate with RM&E dept. in the analysis of Literacy & GEP data trends, identifying potential risks and deviations in implementation of program design.         Keep track of progress towards agreed outcomes.             Reporting:         In collaboration with the CO Literacy and GEP teams, analyse annual program goals and budgets to ensure alignment with organizational strategies and priorities.         Lead and collaborates with the CO Literacy and GEP teams, on developing and providing oversight of the implementation calendar, budget and its guidelines (including contextualization budget), annual planning, HR structure, quarterly reporting, and overall tracking of program implementation and spending.         Collect, collate CO and GO level reports (Monthly and quarterly) from allocated states and review; collaborate with RM&E team for final reporting.         Help coordinate generation and documentation of best practices at the country and state level with the help of state managers.         Generate independent reports on GSD to monitor program implementation, as well as perform data analysis.         Providing inputs to various strategic documents at CO & GO level.         Reviewing the monthly and quarterly program reports of GEP including dashboards and provide suggestions to concerned state teams and departments as and when required.          Coordinating with the allocated states for the effective implementation of the PIM and to work in close coordination with state teams and departments.             Technical Assistance:         Assist the POD and other teams in preparing proposals for technical assistance.         Assist POD in planning and smooth implementation of technical assistance projects and provide timely feedback for process and program improvement.             External Coordination and Networking:         Stay informed about trends in the fields of Education (early grade literacy, girl education and life skills, and Library) and use this information to assess and inform Room to Read s Literacy program.         Build partnerships with NGOs and other organizations with similar agenda as RtR, with the goal of becoming a key player in this community.         Collaborates with the government to build support for early grade reading, life skills, library, in general and the RtR approach in particular.         Effectively oversee senior team members at the state level, such as State Heads, Managers, and Officers, and possesses expertise in capacity building and team management.             Other:         Participate in any other activities which may be required to be undertaken to fulfil the objectives of the organization.         Perform other duties as assigned by POD.         Undertake field visits as required, in consultation with the POD.         Represent POD, in internal meetings, if required.         Represent RtR at various platforms.         Follow up on donor visits in various locations, in coordination with Communications and Dev team.             Qualification & Experience:          Required:         Master s in education / social sciences / Social Work or equivalent.         Minimum 12 years of relevant experience. Should have strong background in project management, encompassing planning, monitoring, and evaluating programs at all levels across multiple states, preferable education projects.         Possesses strong financial management expertise, including annual planning, budgeting, budget outlook, cash forecasting, and the ability to analyze and track budgets for various programs.         Excellent managerial and interpersonal skills, including skills of managing and mentoring people.         Demonstrates excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. The roles necessitate coordination and communication with the Global Office, as needed.         Knowledge/ training in linguistics will be an added advantage.         Should be willing to travel to various states for a minimum of 6-8 days per month.                           To be successful at Room to Read, you will also:          Have passion for our mission and a strong desire to impact a dynamic nonprofit organization      Be a proactive and innovative thinker who achieves results and creates positive change     Have a very high level of personal and professional integrity and trustworthiness      Embrace diversity and a commitment to collaboration      Thrive in a fast-paced and fun environment

column2: Role & responsibilities   Technical Program Manager Making the invisible visible. By harnessing the power of artificial intelligence, were advancing the practice of medicine for doctors and society. And were just getting warmed up. AliveCor , the creator of the smartphone ECG, seeks a Program Manager to join an early stage start-up that is changing the face of mobile health. As the Program Manager supporting the mobile and web-based development processes you will work across a variety of projects, helping to coordinate and prioritize the mobile and web-based development processes across our multiple user segments and geographies. We require this position to be hands-on, to participate in tasks such as managing and guiding the activities of functional and technical team members as needed, resolving project issues as they arise, reviewing deliverables for quality control and managing project documentation. Responsibilities Owns and coordinates the entire program lifecycle from inception to delivery for our mobile and web-based software projects. Help to define and then track and manage the project milestones, resources, and budget. Analyse and manage project risks. Track issues and project status and maintain up-to-date project plans. Work with dev teams to analyse product requirements and drive proposing technical solutions. Work with technical managers to review & add valuable feedback for technical designs & solutions. Work with team members to prioritise & resolve issues, and escalate issues when consensus cannot be established. Schedule and facilitate a variety of project meetings, including status and review meetings for team members and project sponsors. Effectively communicate project status, schedule baselines, schedule issues, project risks and major decisions. Maintain intense focus on delivering to all committed milestones and holds the project team accountable by holding weekly project status reviews. Build capability within the project team to accomplish the project goals and deliver the product to market on time. Must be flexible and creative in thinking to execute to a timeline when plans do not go as expected. Qualifications and Skills Experienced professional who can understand our business and technical needs and establish project direction, scope, timing and staffing that will enable us to deliver successful products.  Previous project management roles for technology-based projects and should be familiar with all aspects of these types of projects including various project management and systems development methodologies. B.E./B.Tech in Computer Science or a related field.  Minimum  5 years??experience in program or project management , preferably with medical device and hardware/technology products as well as consumer health products. Experience with web-based and mobile software project management. Substantial experience in formal project management process, methods and tools; PM certifications are a plus. Ability to articulate and document objectives, progress and issues effectively to technical and nontechnical audiences. Ability to understand business requirements, as well as technical solutions. Have a solid understanding or willingness to learn FDA, ISO13485 quality system requirements for product and software development. Experience with agile development. Must have a strong flair to make decisions for the projects in general and in conflicting situations. Must have excellent planning and organization skills. Must have strong demonstrated teamwork skills. Ability to manage resources across different internal and cross-organizational groups to get things done. Exquisite attention to detail. About Us AliveCor is on a mission to define modern healthcare through data, design and disruption. We??e pioneered the creation of FDA-cleared machine-learning techniques, transformed wearable medtech to put proactive heart care at everyone?? fingertips. Kardia is the most clinically validated mobile EKG technology. AliveCor was named as one of the Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Health for 2017 by Fast Company as part of the publication?? annual ranking of the world?? Most Innovative Companies. AliveCor was awarded the 2015 Tech Pioneer by the World Economic Forum and one of the 50 Smartest Companies in 2015 by the MIT Technology Review. AliveCor recently announced a collaboration with Mayo Clinic that will result in new machine learning capabilities to unlock previously hidden health indicators in EKG data, potentially improving heart health as well as overall health care for a variety of conditions. AliveCor is a privately held company headquartered in Mountain View, CA. AliveCor is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, colour, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Watch the following video demonstrating our product. KardiaMobile: How's your heart? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8I9xosgA-Ig

column2: Overall   Purpose  o f  t he   Job   Responsible for the strategic planning and execution of the Pan-India Critical Health Solutions Operations and oversee the day to day delivery and operational management of the CHS delivery team with the ultimate objective of ensuring a high level of service delivery and meeting program objectives. CHS Services are patient-advocacy services designed to assist eligible employees and their immediate family members with confidential medical support and advice to obtain optimal health outcomes. The CHS team helps eligible employees and their immediate family members with: identifying top rated medical providers (doctors, hospitals, etc), provide medical advice, guidance and recommendations, expediting the resolution of issues and challenges while seeking medical care, navigating the healthcare system, coordinating between care between different providers. Key   Responsibilities   ??Provide strong, dynamic leadership that mentors, develops, and guides CHS team members to  efficiently delight CHS program users and delivers high quality services; ??Responsible for the development and administration of the CHS team budget to attain business goals with operational stability; ??Main point of contact for Goldman Sachs Management team for all matters related to the CHS Program; ??Primary leader of the CHS program team members from an administrative standpoint, fosters  teamwork, maintains a positive working environment, helps resolve and address conflicts within the team; ??Manages and oversees the daily operations of the CHS team (including monitoring and managing activity metrics, case handling, beneficiary satisfaction, etc ??Oversees the roster and team schedules, ensures appropriate staffing levels, organizes Health  Solutions Program team member replacement when there is a gap; ??Provides guidance and coaching to CHS team members to help improve case management and  quality levels; ??Primary point of escalation for all operational related issues, ensuring Medical Director escalation of medical related issues. ??Temporary administrative reliever for any of the CHS nurses in case of sudden/urgent leave; ??Drives the recruitment, selection and on-boarding of new CHS team members. ??Inducts, trains and coaches new members of the CHS team on systems, processes, procedures,  culture, expected outcomes, etc. ??Oversees the medical provider network credentialling process, identifies priorities and providers to be assessed and credentialed. ??The program manager with orchestrate the support of functional experts as part the CHS program; ??Ensures that quality reviews and related activities takes place as per agreed frequency. ??Implements and enforces policies, procedures, standards to ensure consistency and following of best practices. ??Develops, implement and maintain an effective internal Quality Assurance (QA) and Continuous  Quality Improvement (CQI) programs fostering continuous improvement and exceeding agreed  upon Service Level Agreements (SLA) performance; ??Organizes and leads regular team meetings to discuss progress, address issues and work at improving team dynamics and efficiencies; ??Conducts regular performance evaluations and provides feedback to the CHS nurses to help improve performance and case management outcomes; ??Serves as a point of escalation for complex cases and complaints. Undertakes all necessary case investigations and reporting back to Goldman Sachs identified personnel; ??Responsible for generating and reviewing Performance Management reports and reporting back to Goldman Sachs identified personnel on all agreed KPIs. ??Accountable for meeting Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) agreed upon with Goldman Sachs. ??Leads transmission / handover of complex and/or high touch cases that require velvet gloves; ??Provides administrative support to the part-time medical doctors and escalates issues, non-  conformances, accordingly; ??Organizes and leads business / account reviews, meetings with Goldman Sachs identified stakeholders on CHS team performance as per agreed upon schedule; ??Interfaces with Goldman Sachs support functions and relevant departments where necessary. ??Manage and develops Goldman Sachs and co-worker relationships and ensures professional and seamless service delivery of services. Required   Work   Experience: ??Minimum 3-5 years in a service delivery role (>5 years preferred) ??Track record of quality/business process improvement ??Experience of managing a 24/7 Contact Centre operation or a customer facing customer service delivery channel. Required   Qualifications ??Graduate from a premier university with strong academic achievement. ??Project Management Experience

column2: About the Team You will be joining the Fulfillment and Experience (F&E) team at Meesho working on enabling Meesho entrepreneurs deliver a world-class experience to their customers. As one of the prime movers in the e-commerce logistics ecosystem, the F&E team are solving industry-defining problems at scale that few startups can offer globally. About the Role As a Manager- F&E, you'll be responsible for identifying key problems, setting the priorities, coming up with solutions and driving implementation. What you will need Candidates from either Premium or Top B Schools with total work experience of 3-4 years preferred Experience in E-commerce supply chain - Fulfilment, 3PL Logistics and the entire supply chain process, and experience in similar tech startups preferred Strong problem solving, data orientation and analytical skills Solid program and project management skills: ability to lead and collaborate with cross-functional partners, prioritize high impact activities, and work on complex projects Data driven and inquisitive approach

column2: ?       WRI India is looking for a Senior Program Manager - Industry Decarbonisation to join the Energy team which works on projects spanning energy governance, energy access, and energy transitions. The Senior Manager will play an important role in: (a) leading engagements with hard to abate industries, SMEs, policymakers and other relevant partners, (b) leading research and implementation of assigned projects, (c) draw important insights and provide recommendations to meet the goals and create impact, and (d) facilitate on-ground partner-oriented activities at the state or group level. (e) Support the Program leadership in fundraising, donor relationships and team management.         The Senior Manager will provide support for the project, financial, and administrative tasks and help achieve WRI s outcomes by delivering research and outreach on clean energy for MSMEs, Hard to abate Industries, Industrial parks/associations and Commercial Industrial (CI) consumers in India.           How your day will unfold:           The Senior Manager will engage with Large Industries, MSMEs, MSME Associations, group leaders. policymakers and facilitate on-ground activities in different states.         Build relationships with Industries, Ministries, SMEs, state governments, international agencies, MSME organisations, educational institutions, associations, and communities we work with projects.         Lead, conduct, and guide research, develop reports on decarbonisation trends, technology assessment, tools and business models at CI customers, SMEs, and hard to abate industries.         Bring knowledge of industrial processes, abatement technologies, and energy needs to help develop a targeted strategy to accelerate systems change within the sector. Assess the most promising levers of change and design projects and research to maximise progress.         Stay informed about industry trends, policy landscape and sectoral developments.         Participation in partner dialogues, advocacy communicate with civil society, policymakers, business and government partners and multilateral actors active in India s energy transition and represent WRI India publicly on perspectives related to the Industrial decarbonisation strategy.         Document implementation of the project and assist with project-relevant blog posts and other communication documents. Ensuring submission of deliverables and regular reporting         Lead coordination and sharing of capacity building activities. Help with organizing of internal and external meetings, workshops, conferences, and other sharing activities.           Qualifications and Requirements we seek:               Master s degree with a specialisation in engineering / science / management / economics or related field             Minimum 10 years of relevant full-time work experience in the energy/industries sector,             Prior Experience with renewable energy and energy efficiency of industries.             Experience excellent project management             Excellent qualitative and quantitative research and writing skills.                 The ability to work with teams of individuals and colleagues.             Prior Experience in writing policy briefs/publications and delivering presentations.             Preferably BEE Certified Energy Manager/Auditor

column2: Summary: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Program Manager with a minimum of 5 years of proven expertise in implementing enterprise-level ERP or CRM software solutions. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership qualities, project management skills, and a deep understanding of ERP/CRM systems and their integration within large organizations. This role requires meticulous attention to detail, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery. Responsibilities: Project Planning and Strategy: Develop comprehensive project plans outlining scope, objectives, timelines, and resource allocation for ERP/CRM implementation projects. Collaborate with key stakeholders to define project goals, deliverables, and success criteria. Conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. Team Leadership and Coordination: Lead cross-functional teams comprising developers, analysts, consultants, and business stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Provide clear direction, support, and guidance to team members to ensure alignment with project goals and objectives. Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment to encourage innovation and problem-solving. Requirements Gathering and Analysis: Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for ERP/CRM software solutions. Translate business requirements into technical specifications and functional design documents. Ensure that project deliverables meet quality standards and adhere to best practices in ERP/CRM implementation. Vendor Management and Integration: Collaborate with third-party vendors and consultants to implement and integrate ERP/CRM software solutions. Manage vendor relationships, contracts, and service level agreements to ensure alignment with project requirements and objectives. Facilitate communication and coordination between internal teams and external vendors to resolve issues and drive project progress. Change Management and Training: Develop and implement change management strategies to facilitate user adoption of new ERP/CRM systems. Coordinate training sessions and workshops to educate end-users on system functionality, best practices, and workflows. Monitor user feedback and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Quality Assurance and Testing: Oversee the testing and quality assurance processes to validate the functionality, performance, and reliability of ERP/CRM systems. Develop test plans, scripts, and procedures to ensure comprehensive test coverage and minimize risks during deployment. Work closely with development teams to address and resolve any issues or defects identified during testing. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in program or project management, with a focus on enterprise ERP/CRM implementations. Proven track record of successfully leading large-scale ERP/CRM implementation projects from initiation to completion. Strong understanding of ERP/CRM systems and their integration within complex organizational environments. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Solid analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Project management certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) is a plus. Experience with Agile or Scrum methodologies is desirable. Knowledge of industry-specific ERP/CRM solutions (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Salesforce) is preferred.

column2: Position Overview: As a Program Manager at Impact Guru, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, execution, and evaluation of crowdfunding campaigns and projects across various sectors. Collect feedback from clients and stakeholders to identify areas for improvement and innovation. column2: Job Title: Infrastructure Managed Services Program Manager Overview:   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Infrastructure Managed Services Program Manager to lead our organization's efforts in delivering exceptional managed services to our clients. The Infrastructure Managed Services Program Manager will be responsible for overseeing the planning, execution, and continuous improvement of our managed services programs, ensuring alignment with client requirements, industry best practices, and organizational goals. This role requires strong leadership, project management, and technical expertise in infrastructure management. Key Responsibilities: Program Planning and Strategy: Develop and implement strategic plans for delivering infrastructure managed services to clients, aligning with organizational goals and client expectations. Define program objectives, scope, deliverables, and success criteria in collaboration with key stakeholders. Client Engagement and Relationship Management: Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, understanding their business needs, challenges, and expectations related to managed services. Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and retention through effective communication, regular updates, and proactive problem-solving. Service Delivery and Performance Management: Oversee the delivery of managed services to clients, ensuring adherence to service level agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs), and quality standards. Monitor and analyze performance metrics and service reports, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions as necessary. Resource Management and Team Leadership: Lead a team of infrastructure engineers, technicians, and support staff, providing guidance, mentoring, and support to ensure high levels of performance, productivity, and engagement. Allocate resources effectively to meet project deadlines and client commitments, balancing workload and skill requirements. Risk Management and Compliance: Identify and assess risks associated with program delivery, implementing risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans to ensure successful outcomes. Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, industry standards, and best practices related to infrastructure managed services. Continuous Improvement and Innovation: Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency, effectiveness, and value of managed services offerings. Foster a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing within the team, staying abreast of emerging technologies and best practices in infrastructure management. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. 5+ years of experience in program management, preferably in the managed services or IT services industry, with a focus on infrastructure management. Strong technical background in infrastructure technologies, including servers, networking, storage, virtualization, and cloud platforms. Proven track record of successfully leading and managing complex programs/projects, including planning, execution, and stakeholder management. Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients, senior executives, and cross-functional teams. Project management certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) and ITIL certification are desirable. Experience with IT service management tools and platforms (e.g., ServiceNow, Remedy) is advantageous. Additional Requirements: Ability to travel occasionally for client meetings, workshops, or project implementations. Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire teams to achieve goals and deliver results. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.

column1: The Program Manager - Enterprise & Market Development
column2: The          Program          Manager-          Enterprise          &          Market          Development          will          lead          PGPL s          project          activities          on          connecting          farmer- producer organizations (FPOs) and self-help groups with market intermediaries and support the development of micro and small enterprises (MSMEs). S/he will coordinate with the Access to Finance lead in the development and execution of the overall strategic vision,      goal      and objectives of the access to finance component.            The          Program Manager - Enterprise          & Market          Development          will          explore          and collaborate          with different public          and private sector organizations to strengthen the forward and backward linkages in both product markets and input/service markets. This position will assist in developing and managing prototypes towards upgrading value chains          and          develop          scale-up          strategies          for          the          wider          benefit          of          PGPL          project          beneficiaries          and          sub-sector          growth.                                ?         RESPONSIBILITIES          AND          DELIVERABLES      :          (including          approximate          percentage          effort)      Business Development and Branding (30%)              Carry out market research on demand and supply, value chain analysis, business venture feasibility studies,          stakeholder          mapping,          etc,          to          identify          viable          enterprise          establishment          or          strengthen          existing      enterprises.          Support          to          develop          bankable          business          plans          (both          at          start-up          and          growth          stages)          and          connect          with relevant financial and non-financial service providers (medium and large-scale business ventures).          Identify          branding          options          for          PGPL          farmers          products          for          market          promotion          (legal          requirements, compliance protocols, current practices, etc).          Prepare          FPO          enterprise          and          Market          Development          strategies,          roll          out          plans          and          track          progress.          Develop          a          digital          interactive          platform          with          Product-Price          Market          Information          System          (in          goat          value          chain) for the use and benefit of all value chain actors and stakeholders.          Identify          and          recommend          the          best          suited          market          (promotion)          strategies          and          pricing          system          for          the business ventures.          Identify new medium and large-scale business ventures in the selected value chains and provide entrepreneurs          with          assistance          including          formal/informal          trainings          and          coaching,          exposure          visits,          etc          Guide,          coach          and          facilitate          the          Smallholder          Farmer          Organizations          (SFOs)          and          other          value          chain          actors          in the process of branding products.          Develop          project          implementation          plans          for          the          market          development          component          with          clear          timelines          and      deliverables.                      Build          Capacity          of          Project          Staff,          Partners          and          FPOs          (25%)              Assist          to          align          organizational          development          and          business          development          and          build          stakeholders          capacity.          Assist          in          the          preparation          of          a          capacity          building          plan          of          project          staff          and          partners          in          the          field          on          market system development,      enterprise      and value chain development.          Build the capacity of PGPL and FPO staff through facilitating trainings, coaching and other capacity building          initiatives          on          leadership,          conflict          management,          business          development,          governance,          organization development, etc          Facilitate          trainings          and          other          capacity          building          initiatives          as          per          the          Project          Implementation          Plan          (PIP).          Ensure          that          stakeholders          have          strong          knowledge          on          climate          smart          agri      -enterprise          development.          Ensure          that          staff          at          the          partner          level          are          selected          and          trained          as          per          PGPLs          process              Program          Monitoring,          Review          and          Reporting          (20%)            Ensure          that          partners          meet          PGPL s          monitoring          and          evaluation          requirements.          Review          the          project          progress          (physical          and          financial)          with          partner          staff          on          a          monthly          basis      .          Participate          in          ongoing          partner          activities          for          quality          control          and          improvement.          Ensure          the          timely          delivery          of          milestones          relating          to          the          market          development          component.          Ensure          that          the          activity-based          reforecasting          is          prepared          following          the          participatory          method          and          submitted as per the schedule.          Promote          and          ensure          the          participatory          self-review          and          planning          (PSRP)          process          at          each          level          in          project.          Ensure          that          all          project          progress          reports          (physical          and          financial)          are          reviewed          and          submitted          as          per          the      schedule.          Participate          in          all          field          trainings          on          a          quarterly          basis          and          regularly          at          the          initial          stage          of          the          project.          Ensure          that          internal          and          external          field          visits          are          organized          following          the          organizational          protocol.          Facilitate          the          completion          of          Baseline          and          GIM          surveys          each          year.          Ensure          systematic          documentation          of          successes          and          lessons          learnt          for          internal          programmatic          use          and external sharing.          Produce          periodic          reports          and          knowledge          documents.            Develop          Business          Relationships          with          Retailers,          Processors,          and          Other          Market          Actors          (25%)            Facilitate          multi-stakeholder          consultation          meetings,          workshops,          and          business-to-business          (B2B)          meetings to advance better market linkages.          Explore          public,          private          and          producer          organizations          for          joint          initiatives          to          establish          viable          and          sustainable business ventures in forward linkages of the goat meat value chain.          Identify          potential          value          chain          actors/stakeholders          (forward          market          linkages)          and          facilitate          new          ventures.          Establish          functional          relationships          with          market          actors          to          overcome          bottlenecks          in          the          market          system.          Ensure          that          a          goat          market          investment          plan          is          developed          and          implemented          on          public,          private,          producer      partnerships.                    QUALIFICATIONS          AND          SKILLS:            A bachelor s degree or equivalent in Business Administration, Rural Development, Enterprise Development,          Agribusiness      or          a          related          field          is          required,          plus          7 years          of          relevant experience including three          (3)          years          in          managing          teams          in          an          international          organization,          OR          a          master s          degree          in          a          relevant field plus five (5) years of experience. Demonstrated          creativity,          ability          to          think          systematically,          willingness          and          ability          to          incorporate          innovative      solutions.              Excellent          interpersonal          and          communication          skills          with          the          ability          to          work          cooperatively,          tactfully,          and diplomatically with culturally diverse groups of people. Knowledge          of          word          processing,          spreadsheets,      database      and electronic mail software (Microsoft preferred). column2: Objectives of this role To lead the planning, execution, and delivery of complex technical projects and programs within the organization. Leveraging a blend of technical expertise and project management skills, the TPM will drive cross-functional teams to achieve strategic objectives, deliver high-quality solutions, and mitigate risks. The goal is to ensure the successful delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholders, while fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.  Responsibilities Lead the end-to-end planning, execution, and delivery of technical projects and programs, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and priorities. Work closely with stakeholders from various departments, including engineering, product management, marketing, and operations, to define project requirements, scope, and success criteria. Identify project resource requirements, allocate resources effectively, and manage dependencies to ensure smooth project execution and delivery. Proactively identify project risks, assess their potential impact, and develop mitigation strategies to minimize risk exposure and ensure project success. Facilitate communication and collaboration among project stakeholders, providing regular updates on project status, progress, and key milestones. Define and implement quality assurance processes and standards to ensure that project deliverables meet or exceed customer expectations and quality requirements. Manage project budgets, track project expenses, and ensure that projects are delivered within allocated budgets and financial constraints. Manage changes to project scope, schedule, and requirements, and assess their impact on project deliverables, timeline, and resource requirements. Build and maintain strong relationships with project stakeholders, including customers, partners, and senior leadership, and ensure alignment with project objectives and priorities. Identify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and optimization, and drive initiatives to enhance project management practices and efficiency.

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Innovation Manager to join our university-based incubation center programs in India      As the Innovation Manager, you will play a crucial role in driving innovation, fostering entrepreneurship, and supporting the growth of start-ups within our ecosystem      You will be responsible for leading and managing the incubation centers innovation programs, as well as collaborating with various stakeholders to create an environment conducive to the development of groundbreaking ideas and technologies          Roles and Responsibilities:        Develop and implement strategies to promote innovation and entrepreneurship within the incubation center. Organize and facilitate workshops, seminars, and networking events to foster collaboration, knowledge-sharing, and learning among start-ups and stakeholders.      Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to secure funding opportunities for start-ups and support their fundraising efforts. This may involve analyzing training feedback, tracking participant performance metrics, and assessing the impact of training on business and quality outcomes. Should be able to create a report with metrix and KPIs.      Managing the training budget: The Innovation Manager is responsible for managing the training budget and ensuring that programs are delivered within budget constraints. Identifying trainers/metors who suits for designed programs objective and coordinating and monitoring them to ensure program deliverables.      Work closely with the project owner and team members to plan and deliver successful outcomes for program stakeholders      Collaborate with cross functional teams to ensure project outcomes are met. Identify and track quality, operational execution, and customer success metrics.      Should be able to handle cross functions across organization on need basis.      Generate and present required reports and updates to program leads.      Develop and maintain a diverse set of business relationships during program engagements.      Role involves travelling on need basis.      To follow and inculcate a sense of discipline and code of conduct as per the need of organization. Strong knowledge of the start-up ecosystem, including experience with ideation, prototyping, and commercialization processes. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships with diverse stakeholders, including start-up founders, industry professionals, and investors. column2: WRI India is looking to recruit a Program Manager, with over 7 years of experience in management and strategy consulting in the sector or urban and economic development. You have an advanced degree in management or urban development, or equivalent course and a bachelor s degree in urban development studies, urban economics, or related fields. We are looking for demonstrated experience of team management, partner and partner management and willingness to travel to multiple selected cities for project related interactions.       How your day will unfold:            Coordinate an initiative to Develop Strategic Economic Development Roadmaps for city regions to become growth hubs by consulting with multiple teams at WRI India and multiple partners and across multiple city-regions.     Offer strategic guidance and directions in undertaking goal settings for economic context analysis, visioning and opportunity framing, economic development strategies and related analysis for developing selected city-regions as growth hubs.     Support technical reviews and analysis of existing and upcoming interventions and shape the deliverables such as background document on state of the economy, economic context analysis, spatial analytics, and recommendations.     Work with multiple teams and communicate with the WRI India internal team members and partners to achieve project goals and ensure regular progress reporting so that work flows smoothly.     Manage secondary research and writing, on-site project activities such as partner dialogues, partner consultations, and technical reviews based on the needs of the project.     Oversee logistical processes and provide technical design support for all deliverables related to the project activities across multiple city-regions.     Manage overall progress of the project and communicate any gaps/delays if any to both internal and external reporting lines. Help develop remedial measures to address such issues.     Support convenings of multiple partners, experts, mentors, and partners to gather feedback for the study and organising workshops/conferences based on the project need and relevance.     Prepare briefings for the senior team members including director and executive director, to assist with meetings, events, and presentations. Further, help in organizing and administering training and capacity building sessions based on the needs of the project.     Oversee all relevant local financial transactions and disbursal and their reporting following the stipulated WRI India working manual.     Travel to specific project-based cities for meetings and convenings with project partners.         Qualifications and Requirements we seek:              PhD/Masters/Equivalent Postgraduate in management/MBA with a degree in urban studies/urban economics/public policy/planning and governance or related fields     Minimum 7 to 10 years of relevant work experience preferably in a consultancy work environment, managing all aspects of a project including multi-partner consultations, interactions with government agencies and providing strategic expertise.     Acquaintance with project management tools to manage tasks, resources, and milestones, collaborate with teams to prioritize workflows and tasks.     Demonstrate strong report writing and reviewing skills.     Fluency in spoken and written English and Hindi is important.     Ability to combine and present complex information in a simple manner that is suitable for diverse audiences. This will further support interdisciplinary and geographically dispersed teams.     Experience working with the Government Ministries/ Departments and other non-government partners such as Business and Industry Associations, and civil society organizations.     Excellent facilitation for overall team coordination and take on the responsibilities.     Ensure highest standards and consistency of work.
