column2: About Organization :  Sakal Media Group Established in 1932, the Sakal Media Group is the largest independently owned media business in Maharashtra. Headquartered in the educational and cultural capital of the state  of Pune, the Sakal Media Group owns and operates newspapers and magazines in Marathi as well as English with a circulation across Maharashtra and Goa. The Group also has interests in digital media, event management services, and commercial printing and also runs a regional television channel. With a workforce of over 3500 and a vendor network that exceeds 25,000, the Sakal Media Group is a people-focused organization with an open and vibrant work environment offering scope for advancement and growth. Guided by the philosophy of Social First all group initiatives are guided by their potential for social impact and transformation.    Job Title:  Program Manager - Digital News Media Location:  Pune Description: Seeking a dynamic Program Manager with 1-2 years of experience for our digital news media team. Oversee initiatives enhancing our digital presence, ensuring seamless project execution, and driving innovation in content delivery and audience engagement. Responsibilities: 1.  Data Analysis and Insights : Utilize data analysis techniques to extract meaningful insights from digital media platforms and audience behaviour. 2. Project  Management:  Lead project planning, execution, and delivery, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and timelines. Coordinate cross-functional teams for collaboration and project success. 3. Content  Strategy and Development:  Collaborate with editorial teams to develop and execute content strategies for digital platforms. Stay informed on  industry trends to drive engagement and growth. 4. Audience  Engagement and Growth:  Implement initiatives to increase audience      engagement across digital channels. Analyze metrics to optimize content and user experience. 5.  Innovation and Optimization:  Identify opportunities for innovation in digital news media delivery. Drive continuous improvement initiatives for efficiency and effectiveness. 6. Stakeholder Management:  Build strong relationships with internal and external      stakeholders to support strategic objectives. Qualifications: Bachelor's  degree required, with relevant internships or 1-2 years of experience preferred. Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills. Data-driven and results-oriented approach to problem-solving. Experience with content management systems and digital media workflows preferred. Join us in shaping the future of digital news media. Apply now to make a meaningful impact in the digital age! Interested Candidates can share your profiles at sarita.kamble@esakal.com  Thanks & Regards, Sarita Kamble HRBP  People & Culture  Sakal Media Group  Pune, Maharashtra -411007 Sarita.kamble@esakal.com
column11: Project Management, understanding of digital media platforms, Data Analysis, Innovation, Audience Engagement, Problem-solving, Content Strategy Optimization, Stakeholder Management, Communication

column2: As a Sr Technical Program Manager at Avalara, you will be responsible for driving the success of the IT portfolio of projects and programs       You will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing the entire portfolio, ensuring alignment with organizational goals, and facilitating communication and collaboration among various teams     This role requires a deep understanding of SAFe principles, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to navigate complex organizational structures     We are looking for a strong Program Manager, with experience partnering with Sales, Marketing, Information Technology, Support and other organizations to drive program delivery and execution process improvement for our full IT portfolio     You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, scrum team TPMs, partners, and stakeholders to ensure program objectives are met within scope and timeline     This role is an excellent opportunity for an experienced individual looking to take their career to the next level in a fast-paced and dynamic environment              Key Responsibilities:               Communication:     Act as a bridge between technical teams, management, and other stakeholders. Provide regular program updates to senior managers and address their concerns. Manage and resolve risks, issues, and dependencies.                 Portfolio Planning and Strategy:     Work with senior program managers to create program plans and strategies. Lead the development and execution of the portfolio strategy in alignment with organizational goals. Collaborate with key stakeholders to define and prioritize portfolio objectives, initiatives, and investments, including maintaining a multi-quarter portfolio roadmap.                 Portfolio Execution:     Coordinate portfolio activities, tasks, and resources, and remove obstacles. Monitor portfolio progress and take corrective actions as needed. Ensure adherence to program timelines and processes.                 Portfolio Prioritization and Optimization     : Work closely with business leaders to prioritize and optimize the portfolio based on value, strategic alignment, and resource constraints. Implement mechanisms for regular portfolio reviews and adjustments.                 Stakeholder Management:     Keep key stakeholders informed about portfolio progress. Build relationships with program and cross-functional teams to drive program goals. Work with stakeholders to ensure customer needs are met and facilitate communication.                 Risk and Issue Management:     Assess portfolio execution and escalate risks in a timely manner. Track risks to closure to minimize their impact. Identify potential changes to initial assumptions and take proactive steps to mitigate risks.                 Process Improvement:     Identify and implement process improvements across project teams. Participate in quality improvement initiatives. Contribute to improving processes within the organisation.                 Team Leadership:     Lead and motivate cross-functional program teams. Cultivate a collaborative and innovative program culture. Mentor and guide team members when needed.                 Methodology:     Apply the organisations Software Development Life Cycle framework to the program. Maintain standard program documents, such as status updates, program charter, roadmaps, and checklists.         Qualifications             Bachelors degree in a relevant field (eg Computer Science, Engineering).         Minimum 8 or more years of technical project / program management experience in a software, SaaS or systems development environment - including internal process development and change management         Strong knowledge of Program and Project management methodologies, tools, and best practices.         Excellent interpersonal, communication, and leadership influencing skills.         Proficiency in Program/Project management software (eg Jira, Confluence, Power BI)           Preferred           SAFe Agilist, PMP, CSM or similar Project management certification         ITIL Foundation Certification
column11: Change management, PMP, Project management, Process improvement, Sales tax, Program delivery, Scrum, Stakeholder management, Information technology

column2: A "SoC/Full Chip Technical Program Manager" is a senior-level position in semiconductor companies responsible for overseeing and managing technical programs related to System-on-Chip (SoC) or full-chip designs.      The job description for this role typically includes the following responsibilities and qualifications:        Responsibilities:            Program Management:    Lead and manage technical programs related to SoC or full-chip designs, including planning, execution, monitoring, and control of program activities to meet project objectives and timelines.        Cross-functional Coordination:    Collaborate with design teams, verification teams, implementation teams, software teams, test teams, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment and coordination across all aspects of chip development.        Project Planning:    Develop and maintain detailed project plans, schedules, resource allocations, and budgets for SoC or full-chip programs, and track progress against milestones and deliverables.        Risk Management:    Identify, assess, and mitigate risks and issues related to program execution, resource constraints, technical challenges, schedule changes, and budget constraints.        Communication:    Communicate program status, updates, risks, and issues to stakeholders, including executives, project teams, and external partners, and facilitate decision-making and problem-solving discussions.        Technical Expertise:    Have a strong technical background in SoC or full-chip design principles, methodologies, tools, and technologies to effectively understand and manage technical aspects of the program.        Quality Assurance:    Ensure adherence to quality standards, design specifications, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements throughout the program lifecycle.        Continuous Improvement:    Drive continuous improvement initiatives, process optimizations, lessons learned, and knowledge sharing to enhance program execution efficiency and effectiveness.          Qualifications:            Education:    Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field, with a focus on semiconductor design or project management.        Experience:    Several years of experience in technical program management roles within the semiconductor industry, specifically in SoC or full-chip design programs.        Project Management Skills:    Proficiency in project management methodologies, tools, and practices, such as Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, JIRA, Microsoft Project, or similar tools.        Technical Skills:    Strong understanding of SoC or full-chip design principles, methodologies, tools, and technologies, including knowledge of RTL design, verification, synthesis, physical design, and validation.        Communication and Leadership:    Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills to effectively lead cross-functional teams, influence stakeholders, and drive collaboration and alignment.        Problem-Solving:    Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify issues, propose solutions, and make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced semiconductor development environment.        Risk Management:    Experience in identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks and issues related to semiconductor design projects, including schedule, resource, technical, and quality risks.        Results-Oriented:    Proven track record of successfully delivering complex semiconductor programs on time, within budget, and with high quality.
column11: Semiconductor, Manager Quality Assurance, Chip design, SOC, Analytical, Project planning, Risk management, JIRA, Monitoring, Physical design

column2: WRI India is looking to recruit a Program Manager, with over 7 years of experience in management and strategy consulting in the sector or urban and economic development. You have an advanced degree in management or urban development, or equivalent course and a bachelor s degree in urban development studies, urban economics, or related fields. We are looking for demonstrated experience of team management, partner and partner management and willingness to travel to multiple selected cities for project related interactions.       How your day will unfold:            Coordinate an initiative to Develop Strategic Economic Development Roadmaps for city regions to become growth hubs by consulting with multiple teams at WRI India and multiple partners and across multiple city-regions.     Offer strategic guidance and directions in undertaking goal settings for economic context analysis, visioning and opportunity framing, economic development strategies and related analysis for developing selected city-regions as growth hubs.     Support technical reviews and analysis of existing and upcoming interventions and shape the deliverables such as background document on state of the economy, economic context analysis, spatial analytics, and recommendations.     Work with multiple teams and communicate with the WRI India internal team members and partners to achieve project goals and ensure regular progress reporting so that work flows smoothly.     Manage secondary research and writing, on-site project activities such as partner dialogues, partner consultations, and technical reviews based on the needs of the project.     Oversee logistical processes and provide technical design support for all deliverables related to the project activities across multiple city-regions.     Manage overall progress of the project and communicate any gaps/delays if any to both internal and external reporting lines. Help develop remedial measures to address such issues.     Support convenings of multiple partners, experts, mentors, and partners to gather feedback for the study and organising workshops/conferences based on the project need and relevance.     Prepare briefings for the senior team members including director and executive director, to assist with meetings, events, and presentations. Further, help in organizing and administering training and capacity building sessions based on the needs of the project.     Oversee all relevant local financial transactions and disbursal and their reporting following the stipulated WRI India working manual.     Travel to specific project-based cities for meetings and convenings with project partners.         Qualifications and Requirements we seek:              PhD/Masters/Equivalent Postgraduate in management/MBA with a degree in urban studies/urban economics/public policy/planning and governance or related fields     Minimum 7 to 10 years of relevant work experience preferably in a consultancy work environment, managing all aspects of a project including multi-partner consultations, interactions with government agencies and providing strategic expertise.     Acquaintance with project management tools to manage tasks, resources, and milestones, collaborate with teams to prioritize workflows and tasks.     Demonstrate strong report writing and reviewing skills.     Fluency in spoken and written English and Hindi is important.     Ability to combine and present complex information in a simple manner that is suitable for diverse audiences. This will further support interdisciplinary and geographically dispersed teams.     Experience working with the Government Ministries/ Departments and other non-government partners such as Business and Industry Associations, and civil society organizations.     Excellent facilitation for overall team coordination and take on the responsibilities.     Ensure highest standards and consistency of work.

column2: The current opportunity involves working with the Tamil Nadu School Education Department on a System Reform project in Chennai. You will be part of a team that will oversee the implementation of visionary projects aimed at transforming public education in Tamil Nadu. The consultants will however be full-time employees of TEA.         The TEA employees will be based out of Chennai for the duration of the project.          KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:         Support program strategy and approach           Support State Head and external partners team on designing program strategy and creating an action plan for state transformation based on on-ground learnings             Conduct research and analysis (both quantitative and qualitative) to develop the team s understanding of system problems, evidence-based solutions, and innovations in the sector             Design an ME framework with clearly defined performance indicators, targets, and milestones           On-ground implementation and monitoring           Oversee and guide associates on specific verticals in executing the program strategy           Coordinate with partners (government officials, TEA team, partner organizations, etc) to deliver on program objectives.             Enable implementation partners, including government officials, to meet outcome, budget, and timeline targets.             Ensure availability, timely deployment, and efficient utilization of resources             Identify operational bottlenecks and weaknesses, wherever applicable, and devise work-around strategies             Track program progress on key indicators according to the ME framework             Ensure the quality of documents prepared by TEA team members, including reports, presentations, proposals, etc             Travel across districts in Tamil Nadu to oversee the groundwork.           Communication Documentation           Documentation and communication related to program achievements/outcomes and program implementation through concept notes, presentations, reports, approval letters, etc             Documentation on on-ground learnings and knowledge received from external partners to support TEA s internal capacity/knowledge building           Skills and Qualifications           Preferred minimum work experience of 2-3 years including 1-2 years of post-graduation work experience (MBA or MPP/MPA or Bachelor s degree with exceptional work experience)             Experience with on-ground program implementation is crucial for the role             Strong analytical (read quantitative) and problem-solving skills             Experience with ME rubrics and program evaluations preferred             Desired skills include written and oral communication skills, interpersonal skills and networking skills, and the ability to work on tight deadlines             Experiences working with government and in the education sector are desirable, though not necessary             High level of spoken and written fluency in English and Tamil

column2: Title:    Assistant Manager WEP (Women Entrepreneurship Programme)    Location:    Mumbai & Bengaluru    Experience:    8+ years    Reports to:    LEAD WEP (Women Entrepreneurship Programme)        Overview & Key Responsibilities:            Nasscom Foundation s Skills Initiative and Entrepreneurship works to bridge the skilling gaps and support in building and upskilling entrepreneurship ecosystem in India towards its goals of social transformation and impact through technology      The Foundation helps the donor organizations finalize various aspects of the Skill-based CSR intervention targeted towards empowering women entrepreneurs      These include skill-need discovery and identifying gaps with women entrepreneurs that can be addressed with tech-based upskilling, course curriculum and the region of intervention      We work with training partners to plan for entrepreneurship training, upskilling and setting up SME s/Start-up s, targeted towards women and the marginalized      The Foundation has a strong focus to nurture entrepreneurship ecosystem in order to provide sustainable economic growth especially involving women, youth and people with disabilities      We work towards equipping beneficiaries with multiple skill sets including digital and financial with a special focus on technology      Our vision is to build an inclusive and sustainable India by leveraging the capabilities and competencies of the IT/BPM industry      As key member of the team, s/he/they will be managing the Entrepreneurship initiatives of Nasscom Foundation      Broad structure of responsibilities is noted below              Manage and be part of large-scale entrepreneurship /CSR projects.      Work with state teams and local partners/NGO s to implement scalable entrepreneurship strategiesfor testing locally appropriate and innovative projects.      Ensure all projects are delivered on time within the stipulated scope and budget. Coordinate with internal and external partiesfor the flawless execution of projects.      Manage budgets or grants as per the expectations and compliance.      Develop projects and services that generate value for all stakeholders, own the overall responsibility for the successful execution of the project.      Ensure adoption of best practices in projects created and executed.      Contribute to planning entrepreneur portfolio development, determining resource requirements and resource mobilization strategies.      Support efforts to develop new institutional mechanisms/arrangements for entrepreneur program strategy.      Identify key public and private institutions and pursue partnerships towards developing entrepreneurship projects.      Establish professional linkages with individuals / institutions to develop partnerships in line with the entrepreneur strategy-guided partnership maps      Contribute to identifying research priorities, initiate research in key areas towards entrepreneurship development and upskilling.      Any other incidental work as and when required.          Key Requirements:          Experienced with the entrepreneurship development ecosystem; maintains and builds trusted relationships with key donors, partners, and stakeholders in the sector.      Adept with documentation and reporting as per internal/external requirements.      Updated on relevant technology initiatives/components/tools adding value to the entrepreneurship ecosystem with experience in related project implementation.      Knowledge in project monitoring & evaluation (M&E), project-implementation-plan (PIP), impact evaluation and ToC framework and ability to apply the same.      Updated on emerging technologies and can provide need based technical assistance to stakeholders across assigned entrepreneur projects of NF.      Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills (fluency in Hindi is desirable)      Experience of managing Stakeholder/government relationship would be an added advantage.      Demonstrated expertise in sectoral writing-for-sharing, knowledge curation and dissemination would be an added advantage.      We need change makers to drive our inclusive tech agenda. column2: The Engineering Operations (EngOps) team is at the vanguard for developing systems, software, tools, technology, and processes that fundamentally enable our multiple autonomous worldwide engineering teams to build and run their cloud ERP applications. And, we do it at scale with a cloud-first mindset. The EngOps team is responsible for our public cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, developer experience (productivity, systems, processes, tools), SRE, DevOps, FinOps, program management, vendor management, quality frameworks and processes, release management, general systems integration/automation, and vendor management. The EngOps team works closely with a number of other cross-functional teams like engineering, customer support and professional services.         We are looking for an experienced Sr Technical Program Manager (TPM) who acts as a communication hub between EngOps and other cross-functional teams, to drive requirements gathering, collaboration, platform evangelism, adoption and rollout to other teams. The TPM focuses on linking EngOps to engineering, customer support and professional services teams.                     Responsibilities:                     Gather and prioritize technical requirements from internal customers (engineering teams, customer support, and professional services teams) to build the column2: Dear Candidates  We are having a Job Opportunity for a Senior Project Manager Role with Infogain. Please find the Company Description and Job Description below. Company Description Infogain is a Silicon Valley headquartered company with expertise in software platform engineering and deep domain skills in travel, retail, insurance, and high technology. We accelerate the delivery of digital customer engagement systems using digital technologies such as cloud, microservices, robotic process automation, and artificial intelligence for our clients. Our 6000+ global employees are across the US, UK, Singapore, Middle East, and India. Job Location : No.90B,      ELCITA PID No. 295 of Konappa Agrahara, Electronic City, 1st Phase,      Bengaluru 560 100, Karnataka State Job Description: Job    Summary: As a Senior Project Manager for Digital Innovation, you will be responsible for overseeing multiple projects within the Digital Innovation practice. You will work closely with clients and team members to ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet quality standards. You will also be responsible for managing risks, resources, and stakeholders. Strong eCommerce Experience(Magento exposure will be a super plus) to manage multiple programs.   We are looking for a passionate, enthusiastic project manager for digital experience platforms. Candidate should be experienced in the implementation of digital platforms. Candidate will be responsible for working directly with customers, and stakeholders to understand the business problems and opportunities, creating a program plan, change management plan, rollout plan, etc.    The candidate will be responsible for the following:  ??Project Management - Execution planning Governance Planning Resource Planning and seed resource planning Investments and ROI  Transition Management - Change management Rollout planning Implementation to Operations transition planning Escalation/ Crises Management  ??Client Management - Primary contact for the client and as Escalation point. Involvement in client QBRs, Steering Committee meetings, etc.  ??Start Green support and ownership for all engagements??Develop and drive the customer's overall digital transformation strategy and roadmap  ??Creating project plans working with customers and stakeholders  ??Ensures and monitors processes in place to pro-actively protect consistent service quality through rigorous management  ??Review existing business processes and identify areas of improvement  ??Identifying risks/challenges/limitations related to resources and addressing them by creating a mitigation plan??SLA management and customer satisfaction, plan to improve on both pillars  ??Identifying the needs and conducting training/enablement for relevant team members and customer stakeholders??Keeping up to date with digital trends and best practices and getting them adopted by the team??Contribute to RFP/RFI on Digital platforms.  ??Innovative thinker and desire to help us build out new go-to-market offerings and reusable delivery tool kit for a kick start on other engagements.??Understanding current engagements and creating case studies/PoV. Identifying opportunities for accelerator, innovation, and automation and providing inputs to team/ practice. ??ualifications??MBA degree??10 to 15 years of relevant IT experience??2+ years of experience as a Project Manager managing a minimum of 1 MM+ delivery projects??5 + years experience in digital platforms (commerce /experience management/Portals) implementation.  ??Solid knowledge of delivery management, and various delivery models, Understands the Delivery cycle well.  ??In-depth understanding of the SDLC??Experience in a client-facing role??Solutioning, the experience of managed services ??Exposure to sales and customer relationship management??Knowledge of emerging technologies, various platforms, tools, and products, and their respective applications. Desirable skills??Having experience in B2C and B2B implementations. ??Experience in delivering projects on Adobe technologies??Agile Development Methodology experience is advantageous Soft Skills??Driving Execution??Business Acumen??Operational decision-making  ??Motivates develops, and mentors the team where relevant ??Excellent verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills??Strong skills to effectively interface with clients. ??Strong collaboration and team-leading skills??Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills??Self-motivated and able to work with minimal direction Openness to change context menu Compose Paragraph  Kindly share your resume on: Anoushka.Goyal@Infogain.Com

column2: 3+ years experience in Datacenter CE Operations across various functions, or 5+ years of electrical and/or mechanical experience in comparable Critical Facilities operations.         3+ years of program management experience coordinating global teams across time zones in a geographically distributed organization.         College or university degree or additional 2+ years experience.         To promote health and safety in the workplace, employees are subject to required health related screenings, such as hearing testing, which includes both baseline testing and annual retests, where permitted by applicable law.             While not required, we also look for the following     Preferred Qualifications:             4+ years experience in Critical Environment infrastructures (eg, UPS, Generator, AHU) or working in physical IT infrastructures (eg, Servers, SANs, Networking, Capacity, DC Rack/Enclosures, structured cabling)         Experience working with the operation of building cooling, electrical, mechanical, and life safety systems         Experience with Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS), Branch Circuit Monitoring (BCM), and Building Automation Systems (BAS)         Experience in project management or relevant certification/training in project management          Associate or bachelors degree in applicable engineering or mechanical or electrical trades         Project Management Institute (PMI) or similar certification         Experience with physical IT infrastructures (eg Servers, SANs, Networking, etc)                   Responsibilities:                           ?           As a successful Regional CE Program Manager (CEPM), your performance objectives will include               Providing direction, guidance, and oversight on projects, programs, and initiatives for the Critical Environment (CE) discipline of Data Center Field Operations (DCO).         Regional view of datacenter application of Critical Environments Policy and Standards to drive consistency and best practice adoption.         Own and drive resolution of identified gaps in CE programs to allow Data Centers (DC) to achieve more.               Data Center Operations Program Management               Provide project and program management oversight for region wide initiatives.         Serve as the primary point of contact for field CE teams to submit feedback on the CE Program, to include process improvements, updates to standards documentation, tooling improvements/add, etc         Evaluate project scope and resource capacity expectations/asks/assumptions for CE related requests, projects, or initiatives.         Operate as the central point of intake to track and prioritize the portfolio of projects impacting DC CE Operations.         Provide governance, leadership, oversite, and management of regional level programs and initiatives         Maintain project and program stakeholder and sponsor awareness         Ensure the right resources and technical requirements are aligned to projects and that projects are staying within scope.         Demonstrates conscientiousness on cost adheres to budget requirements.         Driving cost/energy efficiency projects                Critical Environments Oversight               Provide recommendations on new data center equipment designs, technologies, and construction methods.         Lead, coach, and mentor DC CE Management teams conducting Root Cause Analysis (RCA) on incidents and outages to ensure presentation to leadership is ready, all aspects are accounted for, and lessons learned propagated to other sites.         Provide additional on-site support to CE personnel as needed during incidents, critical work periods, etc         Monitor the campus/metro risk profile, advise on action plans to reduce overall level, and report/trend progress.         Ensure sites are in compliance with Microsoft policies, standards, Technical Service Bulletins (TSBs), and guidelines.         Assist with the establishment of new DC metro areas within the region by training and onboarding new CE personnel.         Consult on CE related policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures to ensure they are up to date with current industry s best practices, requirements, and learnings and applicable to DC CE Field Operations.         Ensure DC CE Teams and personnel are trained on emergency response best practices and are able to adequately respond to the primary Emergency Operating Procedures (EOP) scenarios.         Help others increase impact by standardizing procedures across area of influence. Drives alignment with region and global team.               Ownership               Realizes that changes impact the work of others and proactively shares relevant information to enable efficient workflow.         Knows when he or she does not have the required information and seeks additional information or clarification appropriately.         Leads change in plans, goals, actions, or priorities to respond to changing situations and champions course corrections.          Works with partner teams and supports others through change management.         Recognizes priority of team success over individual achievement.         Supports team goals and contributes to the success of others.         Collaborates and negotiates effectively with others to identify delegates to deliver results.          In alignment with management priorities, self-accountable for the end-to-end service quality, completeness, and resulting customer experience. column2: This position is a mid-senior level full time position whose principal aim is to help to enhance early childhood education in the state. The Senior Program Manager will report to Program Lead and be responsible for the recruitment, supervision and development of 3-5 statewide program managers.               Key Results          1. Early childhood education provides improved outcomes for children.         2. New state policies are created to ensure and guarantee the improvements.         3. Anganwadi workers and parents increase their skill levels as educators.         4. The new program team is made up of high performers devoted to the cause.               Key Activities          1. Assist the government in charting a roadmap for early childhood education in the state.         2. Build strong relationships with the state and district govt stakeholders.         3. Translate data from the field into insights. Create goals based on those insights, broken down into small, actionable milestones.          4. Hold regular meetings to collaborate with govt partners, understand their work and build personal relationships.         5. Be close to the "customers": meet regularly with the children, their parents, anganwadi workers, district and block level officials and build relationships.         6. All support, safety, goal setting and training needs for your team               Critical Factors for Success         1. Seamless communication with your managers and colleagues         2. Enjoyment and ability to handle multiple projects and solve problems in a high growth, entrepreneurial environment.        ?

column2: The NPI EXPAND India Senior Program Manager will be responsible for overseeing all in-country activities and operations for the project. S/he will be based in New Delhi with travel to Odisha and Jharkhand as required and will work closely with, and provide direct supervision to, the Grants Coordinator and the Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) Consultant. S/he will also work closely with the HQ-based Country Activity Manager and receive guidance from the Project Director and MEL Manager. They will report to the Country Activity Manager based in Washington, D.C. This is a full-time position.        Duties and Responsibilities       The Senior Program Manager will be expected to:            Provide technical guidance to all in-country activities under the NPI EXPAND project.      Provide oversight of project grantees to ensure effective implementation of project activities and adherence to the conditions of their NPI EXPAND subawards.      Hold regular progress review check in meetings with grantees.      Maintain a strong relationship with the relevant government ministries.      Liaise regularly with the USAID India Mission.      Ensure adherence to USAID India s reporting requirements.      Ensure compliance and consistent implementation with USAID rules and regulations and Palladium s policies, procedures and technical guidance, in collaboration with HQ s project delivery team.      Prepare an annual work plan and ensure its implementation in collaboration with the Country Activity Manager, the Project Director, and HQ technical staff.      Prepare quarterly and annual reports for Palladium HQ and USAID.      Review all technical deliverables to ensure quality.      Ensure timely and accurate submission of financial reports in coordination with the Grants Coordinator.      Identify, support and track cost share, and ensure that the Grants Coordinator submits quarterly cost share reports and all supporting documentation.      Provide oversight and ensure adherence to strong internal financial controls.      Maintain all activity documentation (documents, emails, workplans and drafts) in an appropriate location for spot checks and audits.      Ensure good staff management and supervision practices including performance appraisal and development and weekly meetings with the Grants Coordinator and HQ.      Escalate any performance, budget, monitoring, or implementation issues to HQ.      Contribute to BD pursuits and any other projects / tasks assigned by India Business.

column2: Job Description We are looking for a group manager  impact and assessment, who can spearhead the evaluation and enhancement of the school education and social development initiatives. As a key player, he/she need to design and implement robust impact assessment frameworks, ensuring the effectiveness and sustainability of the Shiksha program. Collaborate with stakeholders, analyze data, and produce insightful reports to drive evidence-based decision-making. As a candidate he/she possess expertise in education, social impact, and evaluation methodologies. He/she should be passionate about driving positive change and have a proven track record in impact assessment, apply now to Group Manager - Shiksha Initiative towards impactful school education and social development outcomes. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES  ??Manage, Design & implement comprehensive impact assessment frameworks for school education programs  ??Development of tools to gauge internal audits for the Shiksha Initiative.  ??Spearhead data collection initiatives, ensuring accuracy and relevance of information gathered  ??Collaborate with internal teams and external stakeholders to align assessment strategies with program objectives  ??Analyze quantitative as well as qualitative data to derive meaningful insights on program effectiveness and areas for improvement  ??Produce detailed & actionable reports to inform evidence-based decision-making within the organization ??Stay abreast of education, social impact, and evaluation methodologies, incorporating best practices into assessment processes  ??Lead capacity-building efforts to enhance the understanding & adoption of impact assessment practices among team members  ??Ensure the ethical & responsible handling of sensitive data throughout the assessment process ??Develop & maintain strong relationships with partners (NGOs/ in-house execution team/ external consultant/ IPs), fostering a collaborative approach to impact assessment  ??Continuously monitor and evaluate program outcomes, adjusting assessment strategies as needed to achieve desired goals.  Ensure overall operation team alignment with the larger program goals.  QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor's degree in Education, Social Sciences, or a related field required  Master's degree in Impact Assessment, Program Evaluation, Education Policy, or a relevant discipline strongly preferred. ??Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in impact assessment, program evaluation, or related roles within the social / school education sector  Proven track record of designing and implementing impact assessment frameworks for educational programs, with a focus on measuring social impact and educational outcomes Preference will be given to candidates who demonstrate commitment to advancing educational equity and social development initiatives. ESSENTIALS  Proficiency in statistical analysis tools and data visualization software  Experience in utilizing technology platforms for monitoring and evaluating program impact  In-depth understanding of impact assessment methodologies, including quantitative and qualitative data collection methods  Familiarity with the unique challenges & opportunities associated with social and school education program development PREFERRED  Experience in preparing comprehensive impact assessment reports & presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences Proven ability to collaborate with educators, community leaders, government officials, and other stakeholders involved in social and school education programs. ??Open to travel in project location (min 8-10 days in a month) At Shiv Nadar Foundation (SNF), people remain the highest priority. The organization always prioritizes the well-being of team members while providing new challenges to build professional caliber and most importantly create impact.  All the full-time team members are provided with:  A clear path to develop a career and rise to the highest level in the organization  Focused learning and development support  A well-defined mechanism to map performance, work on individual growth, and be a leader  Supports with Health Insurance for each of themselves  Opportunity to work with Senior Government Officials  Understand governance from both the policy-making and policy-execution perspective  Opportunity to understand Development Project Design  Opportunity to operate at the intersection of policy, governance, and technology  Competitive remuneration  Freedom to experiment with ideas and thoughts  Opportunity Impact the community in a holistic and sustainable manner  Supportive team members and experienced organizational leaders

column2: The State Program Manager (SPM) will report to the National Program Manager at the Delhi Office for overall program related details, especially on policy advocacy and partnership management     S/he will be required to work in close coordination with other departments and team members at the Delhi Office for appropriate functions     The SPM will oversee and be responsible for the Technical Assistance (TA) towards the implementation of the Anganwadi and school based NDD program and any new program that may be implemented in alignment to the EAII expansion plan in the state of Andhra Pradesh     The SPM is responsible for managing all aspects of the TA plans, including strategic planning, policy advocacy, development of operations plan, program management, supply chain strengthening, capacity building, community mobilization, and monitoring and evaluation     The SPM is the program lead to facilitate communication about progress and results at the state office     As for all staff, s/he must possess a sense of collaboration and mutual understanding and a willingness to assist colleagues     The SPM will manage the state level programs related to government and stakeholder relationships, program management, program design and development, budgeting, program and financial review and evaluation activities     S/he should have the skills to supervise and guide state-based program staff as assigned                 Roles & Responsibilities of the position          Program Management and Technical Assistance         Lead the development of annual workplans and budgets for submission to Delhi Office.     Share program reports and updates with Delhi Office on a frequent basis to monitor progress, identify and correct performance problems and recommend solutions.     Manage the state budget in line with the organization s standing financial policies. Share monthly financial reports to monitor expenditure against budgets.     Oversee the management of contracts and budgets as per organization policy, with ultimate responsibility for ensuring programs are implemented within approved budgets and in accordance with organization s compliance standards.     Lead training and other capacity building initiatives along with the state team for implementation of programs with utmost quality. Build the capacity of state team staff.     Supervise team members including full-time and short-term consultants, provide them technical and program guidance, and monitor performance and report to the Delhi Office. For regional coordinators, ensure timely and appropriate support is provided to districts. Review and approve travel plan, fees and claims and ensure timely submission of accurate documents.     Analyse and assess project performance, capacity and demand data to inform changes to project plans and share information with Delhi Office on a regular basis.     Assess, evaluate and document processes and the impact of the technical assistance programs.     Prepare state program report, briefers, case studies, success stories, advocacy note etc as part of program learning documentation and dissemination.          Advocacy and Partnership Management         Lead efforts to maintain a high level of support to Department of Health and other stakeholders as identified for effective implementation of the state-wide school and    anganwadi    based NDD programs.     Lead advocacy efforts in Andhra Pradesh, ensuring that the policy and advocacy priorities are aligned to make deworming interventions in the long term.     Engage with development partners and identify areas for collaboration to strengthen the deworming programs.     In coordination with the Delhi Office, identify, engage and advocate with government stakeholders at the state and district level for effective and sustained integration of interventions in annual work plans and Program Implementation Plans (PIPs).     Contribute to the development of policy briefs, other advocacy / communication materials, including specific inputs into advocacy and communications strategy and campaigns.     Collaborate with stakeholders to identify activities for improved planning, implementation and monitoring of activities under the NDD program.          Strategic Planning         Lead the design of NDD program components to increase deworming coverage in the state of Andhra Pradesh.     Help identify and address bottlenecks and gaps to ensure higher coverage and increased cost-effective across both the NDD program.     Lead the design and development of a sustainability plan for deworming efforts in the state, including an exit strategy for technical assistance for stakeholder requirements.     Lead planning for and organize a broad range of advocacy efforts, such as dissemination meetings for sharing best practices, innovations and coverage results.     Work with the state team and Delhi Office to build robust systems for field operations, especially related to training, community mobilization and independent monitoring.?         Essential         A Graduate with degree in medicine, business, social sciences, public health, health management or related disciplines;     Work experience of minimum 8 years in managing program-related activities;     Strong technical skills and capacity, with at least    5    years of practical experience managing health and/or nutrition initiatives;          Strong leadership skills to lead the state team and manage day-to-day administrative and human resource issues.      Experienced in data review and analysis as a rigorous practice;     Ability to manage tasks, teams, people and financial resources in a way that budgets, schedules, delivery requirements, and staff resources are used efficiently and per work plans.     Proven ability to lead by example, whereby one is receptive to input from others and will respect, empower and energize teams.      Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbal with people at all levels of the organization and external stakeholders;      A critical, analytical, and process-oriented thinker with a willingness to form and adjust opinions based on evidence;      Ability to work under pressure and adhere to deadlines and timely responds to requests;     Experience with creating budgets, keeping program expenditures in line with approved budgets and strategic focus, following financial policies and procedures.     An experienced tech savvy professional with exposure of working on varied tech platforms including Microsoft Office/Google, cloud-based applications, virtual platforms etc     Willing to travel at least 30% of the time.             Desirable         Action-oriented, flexible approach and entrepreneurial problem-solving, with an ability to manage multiple competing deadlines;     Self-motivated to actively ensure that evidence/data-based approach is deeply embedded into all programs;     Prior experience in managing and implementing projects in Andhra Pradesh;     Strong interest in the development sector and desire to be a part of a young and diverse team.         Benefits         Comprehensive health insurance,         Life insurance,     Generous leaves,     Retirement savings options (PF & Gratuity)

column2: The Senior Manager - Electric Mobility will work closely on an electric mobility index initiative at WRI India.      The role requires a mix of technical competence, stakeholder management, and research and writing skills.        The selected candidate will report to the Associate Director- Electric Mobility.          How your day will unfold:          Undertake secondary research and stakeholder consultations to define the requirements of the index        Develop and refine the technical index structure for the electric mobility index        Meet with various stakeholders and make presentations about the index        Coordinate with multiple organizations to collect data for the index        Provide insights into the design of the index interface        Create knowledge products related to the findings of the index for public dissemination        Organize meetings and events around the dissemination of the index        Develop and conduct training programs for index management and ongoing development with relevant stakeholders        Collaborate actively within the electric mobility team to get inputs from sectoral experts on the index                  Qualifications and Requirements we seek:                Masters in public policy, energy management or other relevant disciplines.            Minimum 8-10 years of full-time experience working in the transportation/ urban development sectors.            Proficient at policy analysis and qualitative/ quantitative research methods.          Excellent analytical, writing and editing skills in English.            Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.            Ability to build and maintain productive relationships internally and externally.            Capability to communicate complex ideas in well-organized, everyday language.            Ability to self-manage and meet deadlines, manage multiple projects at the same time.            Enthusiasm, flexibility, technical curiosity, and willingness to learn.            Experience with managing small teams.

column2: As a Staff Technical Program Manager on the Release Management Team, you will be responsible for managing operational release programs and leading strategic projects from start to finish.     You will be responsible for providing innovative ideas to improve business processes and tools while executing daily program oversight of progress, tasks, and risks.     Your primary focus will be supporting product and engineering teams throughout the end-to-end release process, but your responsibilities will also include cross-functional coordination with downstream stakeholders such as legal, go-to-market, and customer support. column2: Program Strategy and Implementation:        Working with leadership in your district, you would need to ensure all processes are put into place and all planned actions are carried out in a time-bound manner.      This includes preparations for the on-ground survey, readying the IT systems, and ensuring that officials are trained in a time-bound manner.      You will engage very closely with the leadership in the ULBs to identify any problem areas, share recommendations and ensure corrective action is implemented.     Stakeholder Management: You will be expected to build relationships with officials ranging from the operational levels of these organizations (Ex. Junior Engineers, Sanitary Inspectors) to the leadership (Ex. District Magistrate, Municipal Commissioners) and drive these engagements to ensure success.     You will also support the ULBs in coordinating with each other.       Monitoring and Review:        Putting in place a robust monitoring and review process will be a key priority.      You will be responsible to ensure structured reviews are held in your area in order to make progress toward resolving the issues identified on the ground.       Program Expansion:        While engaging with leadership across multiple government organizations you would have visibility to understand problem   areas and develop deep insights.      You would be expected to translate these into action and pilot new initiatives which target air pollution in the city you are stationed in.       Vendor Management:        The project is supported by third parties at multiple levels.      You will be responsible to guide and oversee the functioning of these   third-party vendors.      This will include survey agencies, IT vendors, etc.           Eligibility:     1. Masters or equivalent degree from a tier-1 institute with a strong track record of outstanding academic performance   2. 3-5 years of work experience in a role with a client-facing component,   project-based assignments, and substantial analytical requirements   3. Work experience in the space of environment/ solid waste management,   program implementation or implementation of IT dashboards would be   preferred but is not essential however, passion to solve the air pollution   crisis in India is critical     Skills Required:     1. Analytical bent of mind is key you will need to think through problems and   help the team arrive at an accurate assessment of the key issues to be   addressed.   2. Entrepreneurial nature success in this role depends heavily on your ability   to make things happen on the ground.   3. Ability to work alongside senior Government officials, while being able to   convince them to accept our recommendations.   4. Program management skills are needed to ensure programs are delivered   against agreed timelines with requisite quality.   5. Ability to learn quickly air pollution is a relatively nascent space and new   knowledge is constantly emerging which we need to understand and utilize to our benefit.

column2: Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions we re a market leader and growing every day       You can be proud to be a part of technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation     You will be empowered to shape your own career     We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success     Together, we can transform healthcare       The IT Project Manager for Infrastructure and Cybersecurity oversees the planning, execution, and completion of projects related to cybersecurity and IT infrastructure     Responsibilities include coordinating with cross-functional teams, ensuring adherence to security protocols, managing project timelines, assessing, and mitigating risks, and collaborating with stakeholders to achieve project goals     Additionally, this role involves staying updated on cybersecurity trends, implementing industry best practices, and optimizing IT infrastructure to enhance overall security measures     Strong communication and leadership skills are essential for effective project management in this dynamic and critical domain       The role is accountable for development and delivery of comprehensive project plans, program deliverables, including weekly / monthly program updates, KDDs, budget review readiness and management of RAID Logs for cybersecurity and infrastructure initiatives             A Day in the Life           The job responsibilities for an IT Project Manager in Cybersecurity and Infrastructure typically include:                                        Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project plans outlining tasks, timelines, and resource requirements for cybersecurity and infrastructure initiatives. Define the project scope, goals, and objectives, ensuring alignment with organizational strategy. Ensure gate review readiness and facilitate reviews.                                 Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with various stakeholders, including leadership, IT teams, security experts, and business units, external vendors, to define project requirements and expectations.                                 Risk Management: Identify potential risks and issues in cybersecurity and infrastructure projects and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful project execution.                                 Team Coordination: Lead cross-functional teams, ensuring effective communication and collaboration among team members working on different aspects of cybersecurity and infrastructure projects.                                 Budget Oversight: Manage project budgets, monitor expenditures, and ensure cost-effectiveness in implementing cybersecurity measures and infrastructure enhancements.                                 Timeline Management: Monitor project timelines, identify potential delays, and implement strategies to keep projects on schedule.                                 Implementation Oversight: Supervise the implementation of cybersecurity solutions and infrastructure upgrades, ensuring they meet security requirements and organizational objectives.                                 Documentation: Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, progress reports, and post-implementation reviews.                                 Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in cybersecurity and infrastructure management.                                 Communication: Provide regular updates to leadership and stakeholders on project progress, challenges, and outcomes.                                 Customer Satisfaction: Continuously improves stakeholder satisfaction for the Strategic PMO services.             Work closely with all stakeholders to understand the business point-of-view, identify existing processes, customers, and other relevant stakeholders to negotiate and gain cooperation on divergent objectives.                             Processes Standards: Contributes to and cultivates a quality culture which promotes delivery excellence, development of templates tools, process excellence, regulatory compliance, and optimized execution. column2: CENTUM T&S, headquartered in France, is a business unit of Centum Electronics Group (Around 1000Cr turnover organization) offering a wide range of electronic and embedded systems design engineering services to international customers to help them realize complex products and sub systems. It includes design, development, qualification, value engineering, testbench design & manufacturing and many more services. Centum T&S has established its India operations in North Bengaluru, known as Centum T&S Pvt Ltd (CTS), formerly known as Centum ADENEO India Pvt Ltd. CTS is working with many top companies like Airbus, Thales, Hitachi Energy, GE, ABB, DANA, Alstom, etc.,  The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, multi-tasker, and demonstrated team-player. You will be responsible for the delivery of the items assigned to you with quality and should interact with cross functional team and resolve the problem. You should excel in working with global stakeholders and have outstanding communication and leadership skills and report to the Project Manager.  Key values, beliefs, and attitudes   Results-orientation: Focus on Customers, provide quality deliverables on time, within estimated effort with high quality  Characteristics for a design engineering services business: establish trust, responsive to change/adaptability; learn continuously, proactive, positive & joyful. What You'll Do The Software Program Manager & Scrum Master is responsible to identify, establish, control the activities, tools, budget and resources necessary for a project to produce a SW product, in the context of the internal and external projects requirements and constraints. He/she drives the projects execution applying the automotive SW best practices, such as project baseline management, change request, risk assessment and mitigation, problem resolution management, lesson learned and continuous improvement actions.  He/she is the main SW Project Management process owner and, together with Process Development and Quality organization, makes sure the PM process is always UpToDate with the best practices and tools, consistently with the automotive standard (ASPICE, ISO26262, ISO21434). Who You Are? Key duties and responsibilities: Master?? degree in electronic engineering, Computer or technical equivalent. Automotive Electronics or SW experience (>5 years)  Customer (internal and external) interface experience (>3 years) HIgh level understanding of Automotive SW and HW/Electronics solution, vehicle Electric and Electrical architectures, automotive product standards (eg AUTOSAR),, product development experience including automotive HW and SW products. 7+ years work experience in Multiple National Companies 5+ years multicultural people management experiences. ASPICE understanding, OEM and TIER1 typical product development and milestones. Definition of the scope of the work for the project, feasibility evaluation of achieving the goals of the project with available resources and constraints. Sizing and estimation of the activities and resources necessary to complete the work, definition and monitoring of the interfaces within the project, and with other projects and organizational units, plans for the execution of the project definition, implementation and maintenance, monitoring and reporting of the progress of the project, identification and implementation of the corrective (and preventive) actions when project goals are not achieved. Estimate and control the budget of the software departement, the budget includes the software tools, licenses and contractors. Partnering with the quality and product assurance organization, he/she drives the continuous SW project management process improvement accordingly to the relevant automotive standards (ASPICE, Functional Safety, Cyber Security), to make sure Garrett has the necessary level of maturity to become a credible Electronics & SW player.  He/she partners with SW Quality engineer to drive SW design review, maturity steps approval process, baseline and change management, project execution monitoring, risk management, applying quantitative metrics and summarizing them in a few concise executive ones, to be used in the executive reviews. Driving the team through a modern agile approach, playing the role of "scrum master" in the project difficult situation and identify the best compromise to make sure the team has the capacity to deliver. Negotiate with the stakeholders the best, but at the same time feasible milestones timing. Support the team in the operational activities (budget, tool, escalation), unlocking complicated situations. Extract from the team the issues that are reducing the effectiveness/efficiency beyond the project execution itself. PM process (ASPICE ref) & Agile development principles Requirements and SW development tool (JAMA, JIRA) and PM tools (MSP) Ability to interface customers (OEM's)  Demonstrated bias for action/initiative, customer focus, and a strong capability to lead in a team Environment Proven problem solving skills, including ability to interpret data, define actions, and implement solutions Executive oriented communication style Demonstrated English written and oral communication skills and ability to interact with individuals of all disciplines and levels

column2: Job Description Accenture Mobility runs one of the world's largest corporate travel programs covering business travel, assignments and events across 120 countries. In a normal year we take care of over 300,000 travellers and over 50,000 assignees:providing a world class service that allows them to focus on what matters most, whilst continuously striving for cost efficiency and maximized compliance. The Mobility Digital Enablement team is responsible for managing multi-year and strategic transformation programmes across the Mobility organisation. The Corporate Travel & Mobility Associate Manager will be responsible for supporting the team to drive change within Mobility and across the wider Accenture business. They will collaborate across Mobility and partners such as IT, legal, tax and our suppliers to implement new and enhanced services that provide a best-in-class service to Mobility's internal customers. The initial focus of the role will be on managing activities concerned with the 5 streams of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) required for each deployment wave of Accenture's integrated travel tool (Automation, Manual, Early Access/free, End-to-end and Smoke testing): Creation of the overall UAT plan and approach document Development of test scope, scenarios and detailed scripts for each stream, including consideration of local tool configuration variations Liaison with the technical testing team for Automation testing Identification of testing volunteers and provision of kick-off sessions/regular connects/general support for Manual, Early Access/Free, End-to-end and Smoke testing Coordination of third suppliers involved in supporting End-to-end testing Preparation of and coordination of stakeholder approval for the final UAT Testing Report Set up and management of a one-off Smoke testing call on the day after a deploymentThe ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a virtual team across various time zones and will be able to work independently to achieve results. They should have strong stakeholder management skills, a demonstrated history of collaboration across large and complex global teams, as well as experience of requirements gathering and presenting to senior leadership. Experience of the travel industry, Mobility processes and UAT management is desirable but not essential.This is a great opportunity for an experienced manager to grow their skills and expertise, take on new challenges and help improve the services we provide.Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:- Supporting projects related to digital transformation to ensure the overall success of Mobility and meet the objectives set by the Mobility Lead- Working as part of the team to implement complex, global projects within defined scope, timelines and budget- Collaborating across multiple internal and external teams to ensure project outputs are fit for purpose- Driving progress, providing clear tracking and management of progress, risks and issues for leadership and other senior stakeholders- Creating clear design documentation to communicate change, improvements or recommendations for senior stakeholders, challenging the status quo where necessary. Qualification Job Qualifications Must have- Strong written & verbal communication skills, including advanced PowerPoint & Excel- Excellent attention to detail- Ability to simplify complex themes- Proven teaming skills and ability to work with large and complex global teams- Strong Stakeholder Management- Experience of Change Management; Process Design / Proces

column2: We are looking for you to join the Microsoft Cloud Operations + Innovation (CO+I) Engineering team as a Principal Technical Program Manager.          This team, working closely with our Software Engineering and Business teams, builds, and operates, a portfolio of solutions to digitize datacenter planning, procurement, supply chain, Finance and construction with specific safety, quality, schedule, and cost goals.         In this role, you will drive Finance, Costing, Supply Chain Operations and Governance solutions for our Engineering across CO+I organization to transform and digitize processes.          As part of this team, you will help define and drive a charter to deliver against the NorthStar goal of building robust automation for the Finance and supply chain costing functions which will result into 100% schedule & cost predictability and fastest cycle times for DC Capacity Delivery.          To achieve this, you will help build the next generation of solutions which integrate AI/ML based recommendation engines to enable cost and schedule modeling, supply planning, and execution planning while also integrating with the broader CO+I engineering & Corporate ecosystem.         In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.             Required/Minimum Qualifications:             Bachelors Degree AND 6+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development          OR equivalent experience.           3+ years of experience managing cross-functional and/or cross-team projects.           Bachelors or higher degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or extensive proven expertise in the software development field.           4+ years experience in delivering end-to-end Implementation projects using SAP Project and Portfolio Management, SAP Project Systems, SAP S/4, SAP ECC, Dynamics 365                 Other Requirements:              Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.             Preferred/Additional Qualifications:               Bachelors Degree AND 10+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development OR equivalent experience.           8+ years of experience managing cross-functional and/or cross-team projects.           6+ years experience and delivering 3+ end-to-end Implementation projects using SAP ECC, SAP S/4 EPPM, SAP S/4 FICO, Dynamics 365, SAP MDG, SAP Ariba Source to Pay            5+ Expertise in SAP Project Systems, Asset Accounting and Investment Management, cross module integration touch points with Master Data, Planning, Sourcing, Construction, and Asset Management. Integration skills to develop functional specifications for integration with other SAP/Non-SAP Applications            5+ Years Engineering experience of Financial processes in Construction (EPC) industry. Process knowledge and technical and experience in SAP General Ledger, Order-to-Cash, Procurement such, Microsoft Dynamics, processes, along with strong change management, training, problem-solving, and troubleshooting            Knowledge and experience in Finance and supply chain best practices, Including Project and Portfolio Management, Investment Management, Procure to Pay, Asset Capitalization, inventory management, Cost management .           Technical background in SAP, S/4, Microsoft Dynamics, other enterprise resource planning (ERP) and master data management systems and Middleware.           Analytical skills to analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions. Ability to diagnose and guide teams to troubleshoot issues, solve complex problems, and propose innovative solutions.           Demonstrate proficiency in interpersonal, communication and presentation skills.           Experience with data integration, APIs, and cloud-based solutions.                 Tasks               As a Principal Technical Program Manager, your mission is to develop and execute cutting-edge Finance, Governance and costing solutions across CO+I Organization       As the TPM, you'll lead projects from planning to delivery by working closely with business stakeholders and engineers across CO+I engineering     Lead project initiatives, drive end to end digital transformation to implement state-of-art processes & tools and remain accountable for the targeted business outcomes     As part of this role/responsibility you will own building the vision for the business area, driving discussions, and participating in defining the to-be state for business processes and building the engineering roadmap, owning and driving the engineering execution by working closely with engineering leads and the business teams     Develop a clear product roadmap balancing business, technical, and experience considerations     Manage data migration, provide guidance, monitor progress, stay abreast of industry trends, and foster a culture of data stewardship and collaboration     Elevate the Industry with impeccable supplier lifecycle, supplier performance, sourcing, contracting and procurement processes for new data center build and data center operations, solutions and tools         You will identify complex opportunities and gaps across multiple product and service feature areas, collaborate with other departments to evaluate opportunity, define solution options, and propose a roadmap.               You will partner with Business and Software Engineering to design technical solutions across feature areas. you'll also identify risks and propose data-based mitigations.         You will develop and execute a comprehensive project plan for cross system integration.         You will partner cross teams and coordination for timelines with internal and external partners.         You will create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to integration processes and configurations.         you'll define success criteria and create relationships for implementing features for complex cross-functional projects. you'll coordinate and ensure alignment across organizations.         You will deliver on roadmap for multiple feature groups, track project schedules, develop staging and implementation plan, and manage governance programs.         You will drive continuous improvements by validating use cases and writing test cases from scratch. you'll also lead teams to partner with other departments to collect performance metrics, drive customer support, and lead direct customer engagements.

column1: Product / Program Manager Solar Rooftop Finance
column2: Essential Qualification:    Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or related field        Preferred Qualification:    MBA, Deep understanding of solar energy market dynamics, financing models, and regulatory environment in India.         Role Summary         You will be responsible for leading the development and management of our solar financing products and services     You will work closely with cross-functional teams to launch and optimize financing solutions that meet the needs of our target market and drive business growth     If you are passionate about driving innovation, expanding access to solar energy, and making a positive impact on the environment and society, we invite you to join our team as a Product Manager for Solar Rooftop Finance     Together, we can empower individuals and businesses to embrace clean energy solutions for a brighter, more sustainable future         Job Description         Drive solar rooftop financing products pan India.     Define product features, pricing, and terms as per regional requirements.     Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, preferences, and competitive landscape.     Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including sales, marketing, IT, Risk, Process and finance, to gather insights and inputs for product implementation and innovations.     Develop and execute strategic plans to drive adoption of solar rooftop financing products among residential, commercial, and industrial customers.     Identify target segments, channels, and partnerships to maximize market reach and penetration.     Monitor market trends, regulatory developments, and competitor activities to inform product strategy and positioning.     Keep a tap on seamless and user-friendly customer experience throughout the financing process, from application to disbursement.     Gather feedback from customers and stakeholders to continuously improve product features and service delivery.     Monitor portfolio performance and delinquency trends to identify early warning signals and take proactive measures as needed.     Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies related to solar financing products.     Maintain documentation and records in accordance with regulatory standards and best practices.
