column1: State Program Manager (SPM)- NCD & CPHC Division
column2: Swasthya Sankalp is committed to improving public health outcomes, with a particular focus on Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) such as hypertension and diabetes. As part of our efforts to enhance comprehensive primary care services, we are seeking a qualified and experienced individual to serve as the State Program Officer for the state. The primary objective of this position is to provide technical and programmatic support in the design, implementation and monitoring of cardiovascular health interventions, focused on improving control of hypertension and diabetes at the primary health care level in selected geographies in the state. The SPM will work closely with the State NCD Nodal Officer and Comprehensive Primary Health Care (CPHC) Nodal Officer to implement strategies for improving screening, diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up care for individuals with hypertension and diabetes at the primary health care level.    Roles and Responsibilities     ?   Expected role of the incumbent is multi-dimensional and are summarised below:   ?     Conduct landscaping and situational assessment of hypertension and diabetes service delivery at primary healthcare level across implementation geographies.   Collaborate with the State officials to develop and implement state-specific strategies for strengthening hypertension and diabetes management and control at primary health level.   Provide technical assistance and strengthen the capacity of the State and selected districts for planning, training, supervision and monitoring of hypertension and diabetes service delivery.   Work with state and district officials for developing and implementing state program implementation plans (PIP) towards ensuring adequate financial resources under NP-NCD and CPHC program.   Strengthen opportunistic screening at the health facilities and streamline linkages with population-based screening for diagnosis of hypertension and diabetes.   Accelerate implementation of hypertension & diabetes protocol-based patient-centred services.   Assist in planning and monitoring uninterrupted availability of anti-hypertensive and anti-diabetic drugs at all AAMs in intervention geographies and strengthening of overall drug procurement and supply chain system.   Identify knowledge gaps and opportunities for improvement in knowledge management processes and propose and implement solutions to address them.   Conduct needs assessments and gap analyses to identify areas for improvement in chronic disease management services and develop strategies to address them.   Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to promote awareness of NCDs, risk factors, and preventive measures through community outreach programs, workshops, and educational materials.   Conduct regular supportive supervision visits to implementation sites and provide technical assistance and guidance to AAM staff to ensure adherence to evidence-based guidelines and best practices in hypertension and diabetes management.   Support uptake and utilisation of NCD information system, monitor key indicators, and provide regular reports to relevant stakeholders to improve program implementation.   Participate in meetings at block, district and state level and provide timely updates/ reports to health department.   Support the health department in finalising PIP for NCD at district / state level.    Map/identify non-governmental agencies actively involved in NCDs in the identified district/s and develop networks.?   Streamline institutional mechanisms for regular review of NP-NCD program and support rapid cycle process improvements.   Prepare monthly reports on the progress of the project with follow-up on action points and share feedback to state NCD and CPHC cell.   Support state officials in making technical presentations, strategic documents required for decision making and documentation of good practices as relevant to the project.   Any other task assigned by appropriate authority.     ?   ?   The position requires extensive travel (up to about 10 days in a month) within state.   ?   In addition to the above-mentioned roles and responsibilities, s/he will collaborate with existing projects initiatives in the state to integrate hypertension and diabetes management into performance monitoring frameworks for CPHC services.   ?   The SPM should possess the following qualifications and experience:   ?     Medical/Nursing graduation  with an essential  post-graduate degree in public health/Health Administration/Health Policy, or a related field is required . A  specialization or coursework related to chronic diseases like hypertension, and diabetes is preferred.   A t least  5+ years  of relevant experience in public health program management, preferably in the field of non-communicable diseases (NCDs) with a focus on hypertension, diabetes and health system strengthening.   Experience in working with government health agencies at state level.   Strong understanding of primary healthcare systems, including experience working with public health facilities at the state or district level.   Experience in  designing, implementing, and monitoring health programs , particularly those targeting prevention, early detection.    Demonstrated experience in working with  government health agencies, NGOs, and other stakeholders involved in healthcare delivery .   E xperience in capacity building, training, and providing technical assistance to healthcare providers and community health workers.   Proven track record   of managing budgets, procurement, and financial reporting related to health programs.   Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.   Proficiency in MS Office package.   Fluent in  English, Hindi, and the proposed state?? language , enabling effective communication with stakeholders at all levels within the stat e.     ?   Note: -     Incumbent is expected to have excellent writing skills and language proficiency, for which a screening test may be administered.     ?   ?

column2: Summary: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Program Manager with a minimum of 5 years of proven expertise in implementing enterprise-level ERP or CRM software solutions. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership qualities, project management skills, and a deep understanding of ERP/CRM systems and their integration within large organizations. This role requires meticulous attention to detail, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery. Responsibilities: Project Planning and Strategy: Develop comprehensive project plans outlining scope, objectives, timelines, and resource allocation for ERP/CRM implementation projects. Collaborate with key stakeholders to define project goals, deliverables, and success criteria. Conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. Team Leadership and Coordination: Lead cross-functional teams comprising developers, analysts, consultants, and business stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Provide clear direction, support, and guidance to team members to ensure alignment with project goals and objectives. Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment to encourage innovation and problem-solving. Requirements Gathering and Analysis: Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for ERP/CRM software solutions. Translate business requirements into technical specifications and functional design documents. Ensure that project deliverables meet quality standards and adhere to best practices in ERP/CRM implementation. Vendor Management and Integration: Collaborate with third-party vendors and consultants to implement and integrate ERP/CRM software solutions. Manage vendor relationships, contracts, and service level agreements to ensure alignment with project requirements and objectives. Facilitate communication and coordination between internal teams and external vendors to resolve issues and drive project progress. Change Management and Training: Develop and implement change management strategies to facilitate user adoption of new ERP/CRM systems. Coordinate training sessions and workshops to educate end-users on system functionality, best practices, and workflows. Monitor user feedback and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Quality Assurance and Testing: Oversee the testing and quality assurance processes to validate the functionality, performance, and reliability of ERP/CRM systems. Develop test plans, scripts, and procedures to ensure comprehensive test coverage and minimize risks during deployment. Work closely with development teams to address and resolve any issues or defects identified during testing. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in program or project management, with a focus on enterprise ERP/CRM implementations. Proven track record of successfully leading large-scale ERP/CRM implementation projects from initiation to completion. Strong understanding of ERP/CRM systems and their integration within complex organizational environments. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Solid analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Project management certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) is a plus. Experience with Agile or Scrum methodologies is desirable. Knowledge of industry-specific ERP/CRM solutions (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Salesforce) is preferred.

column2: Job Objective: As a Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager Admin, you will be responsible for configuring, managing, and optimizing Google Tag Manager (GTM) and Google Analytics (GA) implementations to ensure accurate tracking and reporting of website performance metrics. You will collaborate with the Marketing team to gather tracking requirements, translate them into GTM configurations, and lead the end-to-end implementation of GTM solutions. Additionally, you will work with our data analytics team to cross-validate tracking systems and ensure data consistency between GA4 and PowerBi dashboards. Responsibilities:  Google Tag Manager Custom Configurations: Configure and manage GTM accounts, containers, tags, triggers, and variables to meet specific tracking requirements. Develop custom GTM tags using JavaScript and HTML to track user interactions, events, and conversions on web pages. Implement advanced tracking features like cross-domain tracking, enhanced e-commerce tracking, and custom dimensions/metrics in GA via GTM.  Event and Conversion Tracking: Define and implement event tracking to capture user interactions, such as page views, clicks, form submissions, video views, and other custom events. Set up conversion tracking to measure important actions or goals completed by users, such as purchases, sign-ups, downloads, or other key conversions.  Testing and Troubleshooting: Thoroughly test and debug GTM tags to ensure accurate data collection and prevent data discrepancies. Monitor and analyze GTM data to identify tracking issues, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization. Provide recommendations to improve tracking and ensure data consistency and accuracy. Collaboration: Work with the marketing team and developers to implement data layer specifications and ensure seamless data flow between the website and GTM. Collaborate with our data analytics team to cross-validate tracking systems and ensure data consistency between GA4 and PowerBi dashboards. Provide technical support and collaborate with cross-functional teams as needed.  Documentation & Training: Create and maintain documentation for GTM configurations, tagging strategies, and tracking implementations. Provide support to internal stakeholders on GTM and GA4 usage, troubleshooting, and best practices.  Reports & Data Visualization: Develop and implement custom reports in GA4 to provide insights into key performance indicators (KPIs), user behavior, and conversion pathways. Utilize explorer reports in GA4 to visualize and explore data trends, patterns, and anomalies for deeper insights into website performance. Interpret user journey stories using GA4 to understand how visitors navigate through the website and optimize conversion funnels.
column11: GTM accounts, GTM manager, containers, triggers, tags
